문제: 1. According to the Road Traffic Act, the term 'novice driver' means a person who has ( ) yet to lapse from thedate he/she obtains his/her driver's license. Which answer fits in ( )?
보기1: ① 2 years
보기2: ② 3 years
보기3: ③ 4 years
보기4: ④ 5 years

문제: 2. Which of the following persons is NOT subject to a recommendation of special traffic safety education?
보기1: ① A person who has obtained his/her driver's license, and is 65 years of age or older on the day of education
보기2: ② A person received mandatory special traffic safety education as a novice driver who has received a disposition tosuspend the effect of his or her driver's license and for whom the period of suspension has yet to lapse.
보기3: ③ A person whose driver's license can be potentially suspended due to reasons such as traffic infringements
보기4: ④ A person whose driver's license has been canceled due to failure in taking an aptitude test

문제: 3. Which of the following is the age limit for obtaining a Class II driver's license for small motor vehicles under theRoad Traffic Act?
보기1: ① 15 years old or older
보기2: ② 16 years old or older
보기3: ③ 17 years old or older
보기4: ④ 18 years old or older

문제: 4. Which of the following tests is mandatory for a person with a driver's license for motorcycles when seeking aClass II driver's license for small motor vehicles?
보기1: ① Aptitude test
보기2: ② Skill test
보기3: ③ Road code test
보기4: ④ Inspection test

문제: 5. Which of the following cannot be driven by a person holding a Class II driver's license for small motor vehicles?
보기1: ① A 100 cc two-wheeled vehicle
보기2: ② A 125 cc two-wheeled vehicle
보기3: ③ A 250 cc two-wheeled vehicle
보기4: ④ A 800 cc small passenger car

문제: 6. Which of the following can be driven by a person holding a Class II driver's license for small motor vehicles?
보기1: ① A forklift under 3 tons
보기2: ② A passenger car
보기3: ③ A motorcycle
보기4: ④ A three-wheeled passenger car

문제: 7. Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following explanations of driver’s license is correct? (except formobility-disadvantaged persons under the Act on Promotion of the Transportation Convenience ofMobility-disadvantaged Persons)
보기1: ① Persons aged over 13 can drive personal mobility devices without a driver’s license.
보기2: ② If an individual aged 16 or more wants to drive personal mobility devices, he/she should obtain a driver’s license.
보기3: ③ Children should obtain a driver’s license to drive personal mobility devices within a maximum of 20km or less.
보기4: ④ Adults are not obliged to obtain a driver’s license if they intend to drive personal mobility devices within amaximum of 20km or less.

문제: 8. Which of the following is a correct explanation of the definition (standard) for a motorcycle under the Road TrafficAct?
보기1: ① It includes all two-wheeled vehicles
보기2: ② It refers to a two-wheeled vehicle with a displacement of 250 cc or less under the Automobile Management Act.
보기3: ③ It refers to a vehicle equipped with a motor showing displacement of less than 50 cc and a rated output of lessthan 0.59 kilowatts.
보기4: ④ It refers to a two-wheeled vehicle with a displacement of 125 cc or less and a maximum rated output of 11kilowatts or less.

문제: 9. Which of the following has the authority to issue you a replacement for a lost or damaged driver's license?
보기1: ① Head of a Gun
보기2: ② A mayor
보기3: ③ A Provincial governor
보기4: ④ The commissioner of City/Do police agency

문제: 10. Which of the following is the renewal period for a person with a Class II driver's license (excluding drivers aged65 and above) for small motor vehicles?
보기1: ① Every three years
보기2: ② Every five years
보기3: ③ Every seven years
보기4: ④ Every ten years

문제: 11. Which one of the following persons is NOT eligible to receive an international driving permit?
보기1: ① A person who holds a Class I driver’s license for large towing vehicles
보기2: ② A person who holds a Class I driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles
보기3: ③ A person who holds a Class II driver’s license for small motor vehicles
보기4: ④ A person who holds a Class II driver’s license for motorcycles

문제: 12. According to the Road Traffic Act, a driver must be ( ) and older to be eligible for a Class II driver’s license formotorcycles. Which answer fits in ( )
보기1: ① 13 years old
보기2: ② 14 years old
보기3: ③ 15 years old
보기4: ④ 16 years old

문제: 13. From which one of the following tests is a person with a Class II driver's license for small motor vehiclesexempted when applying for a Class II driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles?
보기1: ① Aptitude test
보기2: ② Skill test
보기3: ③ Road code test
보기4: ④ Inspection test

문제: 14. Which of the following vehicles cannot be driven by a person holding a Class II driver’s license for motorcyclesunder the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Multi-wheeled type of two-wheeled vehicles with 100 cc displacement
보기2: ② Two-wheeled vehicle with 49 cc displacement
보기3: ③ Two-wheeled vehicle with 200 cc displacement
보기4: ④ A vehicle equipped with a motor featuring maximum rated output of 10 kilowatts

문제: 15. Which of the following is a requirement to pass the aptitude test for a Class II driver’s license for motorcycles?
보기1: ① Visual acuity of 0.4 or higher (with both eyes opened)
보기2: ② Visual acuity of 0.6 or higher in one eye if the person has usable vision in only one eye
보기3: ③ Ability to hear 55-decibel sounds
보기4: ④ Ability to hear 40-decibel sounds if the person uses a hearing aid

문제: 16. Which of the following statements about the structural modification of a two-wheeled vehicle is correct?
보기1: ① Any structural modification of a two-wheeled vehicle must be reported to the police department.
보기2: ② Structural modification of a two-wheeled vehicle is not allowed under any circumstances.
보기3: ③ Illegal structural modification of a two-wheeled vehicle is subject to penalty.
보기4: ④ A two-wheeled vehicle can be structurally modified by its owner without obtaining a permit.

문제: 17. Under the Motor Vehicle Management Act, two-wheeled vehicles that have a maximum speed of ( ) km/h aresubject for registration. Which of the following is correct?
18. Under the compulsory Motor Vehicle Liability Security Act, which of the following insurances must be purchasedwhen registering the use of a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① Comprehensive insurance
보기2: ② Accident insurance
보기3: ③ Liability insurance
보기4: ④ Driver insurance

문제: 19. Under the Automobile Management Act, when ownership of a two-wheeled vehicle is transferred through a sale,which of the following is the criterion of a deadline for registration of the change?
보기1: ① Within 7 days from the date of purchase
보기2: ② Within 10 days from the date of purchase
보기3: ③ Within 15 days from the date of purchase
보기4: ④ Within 30 days from the date of purchase

문제: 20. Which of the following correctly describes the method for inspecting the tires of a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① Always inspect air pressure in the tires visually.
보기2: ② Tire wear has no impact on driving safety.
보기3: ③ Reduced air pressure in the tires increases braking efficiency.
보기4: ④ Tires should be inspected regularly to ensure safe driving.

문제: 21. Which of the following is the most appropriate explanation for the safety standards of two-wheeled vehicles interms of the performance and standards applicable to automobiles and automobile parts? (Excluding largetwo-wheeled vehicles)
보기1: ① The length should not exceed 2.5 meters in the unloaded condition excluding any sidecar.
보기2: ② The vehicle should not exceed 1.5 meters in width and 2.5 meters in height in the unloaded condition excludingany sidecar.
보기3: ③ The gross weight of a two-wheeled vehicle of miscellaneous type should not exceed 500 kg.
보기4: ④ The gross weight of a special type two-wheeled vehicle should not exceed 700 kg.

문제: 22. Which of the following best describes the correct management of motor vehicle tires?
보기1: ① Tires are used until the tread is completely worn off.
보기2: ② The higher the tire pressure, the better.
보기3: ③ It is advisable to replace tires on a regular basis.
보기4: ④ Car tires and fuel-efficiency are unrelated.

문제: 23. Which one of the following two-wheeled vehicle categories should be registered and reported to the head of aSi/Gun/Gu (borough)?
보기1: ① A two-wheeled vehicle with an engine displacement of 49 cc and maximum speed of 25 kilometers per hour orhigher
보기2: ② A two-wheeled vehicle without a differential gear, designed mainly for mountainous terrains
보기3: ③ A two-wheeled vehicle with steering and brake systems that cannot be controlled manually, designed mainly forpurposes other than roadway travel
보기4: ④ A medical mobility scooter

문제: 24. Which one of the following statements on the inspection of two-wheeled vehicle brakes is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Check whether the brake levers are firm by squeezing the levers as you move the motorcycle slowly. If necessary,adjust the levers.
보기2: ② Brake fluid is not a consumable, and it is not necessary to change it. You only need to check the level and addfluid when necessary.
보기3: ③ Check the brake pads and discs for signs of wear on a regular basis. Change them when necessary.
보기4: ④ Check for any leakage of brake fluid. Fix any leaks.

문제: 25. Which of the following is not the precautions in case of a fire in high voltage battery system of an electricvehicle?
보기1: ① Turn off the vehicle system immediately in case of fire.
보기2: ② When extinguishing fire, use a fire extinguisher charged with liquid carbon dioxide.
보기3: ③ If it is impossible to extinguish the fire, evacuate to a safe place.
보기4: ④ There is no need to tell the fire department whether it is fire on an electric vehicle.

문제: 26. Which one of the following statements regarding the risk presented by excessive pressure in two-wheeled vehicletires is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① It is easier for tires to slip.
보기2: ② The tread center wears out quickly.
보기3: ③ The contact surface becomes smaller.
보기4: ④ The handle gets heavier.

문제: 27. Which of the following statements regarding the risk presented by low pressure in two-wheeled vehicle tires isINCORRECT?
보기1: ① The contact surface becomes wider.
보기2: ② Fuel is wasted.
보기3: ③ At high speeds, an underinflated tire can prevent accidents caused by tire bursting.
보기4: ④ It is less slippery.

문제: 28. Which of the following statements regarding the role of engine oil in two-wheeled vehicles is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① It lubricates.
보기2: ② It heats up the engine and enhances performance.
보기3: ③ It cleans.
보기4: ④ It prevents wearing of the parts.

문제: 29. Under the Automobile Management Act, which of the following is the correct penalty imposed on a driver whooperated a motorcycle without a license plate attached to the vehicle? (In case of the 1st violation)
보기4: ④ 1 million won

문제: 30. Which of the following is NOT correct regarding a driver's compliance with the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Cyclists should not ride bicycles that may pose a risk to traffic safety.
보기2: ② Drivers using motorcycles must ensure that their passengers also wear life protection equipment.
보기3: ③ Motorcyclists do not need to recommend that their passengers wear life protection equipment.
보기4: ④ A driver of a personal mobility device should not drive with passengers in excess of the number of riders inaccordance with the Road Traffic Act and its enforcement decree.

문제: 31. Which of the following is a correct and safe way to switch lanes?
보기1: ① Catch up to the vehicle in front of you so that others cannot cut in front of you.
보기2: ② Change lanes quickly even though it may obstruct or pose a danger to other drivers.
보기3: ③ Turn on the hazard lights when changing lanes.
보기4: ④ Turn on the turning signal to let other drivers know and change lanes safely.

문제: 32. Which of the following has the greatest impact on a driver's driving behavior?
보기1: ① How the driver acquired his/her license
보기2: ② The driver's educational background
보기3: ③ Type of driver's license
보기4: ④ Physical condition of the driver

문제: 33. Which of the following advice on first aid for a traffic accident victim is correct?
보기1: ① If the victim is unconscious, turn the victim over onto his stomach to clear the airway.
보기2: ② An injured person who is conscious shall take assistance for psychological stability.
보기3: ③ Perform resuscitation if the victim's airway is blocked.
보기4: ④ When the injured person is suffering from a fracture, strongly press the fractured area with hands

문제: 34. Which of the following is the most appropriate action for a driver to take after witnessing a traffic accident?
보기1: ① Move the injured person, regardless of the severity of his or her injury.
보기2: ② As the situation is none of your business, leave the site of the accident quickly.
보기3: ③ If there is a vehicle fleeing the scene, chase and apprehend the vehicle and driver.
보기4: ④ Report the accident to the police station or 119 (emergency number), explaining the level of injury.

문제: 35. Which of the following example describes the correct order of a driver's behavior?
보기1: ① Recognition → Judgement → Execution
보기2: ② Judgement → Recognition → Execution
보기3: ③ Execution → Judgement → Recognition
보기4: ④ Recognition → Execution → Judgement

문제: 36. Which of the following has a higher chance of occurrence during the night than during the day?
보기1: ① Economic driving
보기2: ② Limited sight and reduced visibility
보기3: ③ Reckless driving
보기4: ④ Speeding

문제: 37. You drove over a broken yellow line in the center of the road to overtake a vehicle ahead of you, only to see avehicle speeding toward you from the opposite direction. Which of the following is the safest way to drive in thissituation?
보기1: ① Abort the overtake and return to your lane.
보기2: ② Switch on your headlights and sound the horn to convince the approaching vehicle to let you finish passing.
보기3: ③ Speed up to complete overtaking the vehicle as quickly as possible.
보기4: ④ Stop right there or drive onto the edge of the road.

문제: 38. What is the section of the road where you must stop at the stop line or continue on depending on the trafficsignal?
보기1: ① A dilemma zone
보기2: ② A no-parking zone
보기3: ③ A speed zone
보기4: ④ A stop-line zone

문제: 39. Which of the following is the safest way to drive in fog when there is low visibility?
보기1: ① If visibility is poor, it is OK to cross the center line.
보기2: ② Turn on the headlights and use the vehicle horn to let the vehicle on the opposite side know you are trying toovertake the vehicle in front of you.
보기3: ③ Turn on the headlights or fog lamps to make your vehicle more visible in the fog.
보기4: ④ Drive fast to get out of the fog.

문제: 40. Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following should not be followed by a driver of a personal mobilitydevice?
보기1: ① The number of revolutions of the motor should not be increased.
보기2: ② If an elderly person who cannot use the overpass is crossing the road, the driver should stop the vehicletemporarily.
보기3: ③ A driver should not drive the vehicle if there is a risk of not being able to drive normally (e.g. due to theinfluence of drugs).
보기4: ④ Make sure that the water does not splash over to other people while driving over a puddle of water.

문제: 41. If a vehicle ahead of you entering an intersection without traffic lights is making a left turn, what should you do?
보기1: ① Proceed with caution if you are going to pass straight through.
보기2: ② If you are going to turn right, make a right turn at a reduced speed.
보기3: ③ If you are going to go straight through or take a right turn, yield to vehicles making left turns.
보기4: ④ If you are driving on a narrow road, pass through the intersection at a reduced speed.

문제: 42. Which of the following statements about stopping/parking a two-wheeled vehicle is the WORST advice?
보기1: ① When you stop or park your two-wheeled vehicle after driving, ensure that the extremely heated engine andmuffler areas are out of reach for pedestrians.
보기2: ② Stop and/or park your two-wheeled vehicle on a flat surface if possible.
보기3: ③ Set up support on soft ground to stop or park.
보기4: ④ Do not stop/park in areas that interfere with pedestrian traffic.

문제: 43. On a general roadway with one lane in each direction, the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle sees a bus aheadstopping on the right side of the road. Which of the following is the safest action to take?
보기1: ① Cross the solid-lined center line and overtake the bus.
보기2: ② Drive along the sidewalk to the right.
보기3: ③ Use the horn and drive along the left side of the bus.
보기4: ④ Stop behind the bus and wait for the bus to start moving.

문제: 44. According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following acts by motorcyclists is NOT considered a trafficoffense?
보기1: ① Drunk driving
보기2: ② Touching the display screen to operate a device while driving
보기3: ③ Failure to meet the standards for the permeability of visible rays through window glass of the motorcycle
보기4: ④ Stopping/parking in a restricted area

문제: 45. Which of the following describes a good habit for a person while driving a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① When you see congested traffic on the road, use the pedestrian path.
보기2: ② Even if you do not see any senior citizens while in a protection area for older persons, adhere to the speed limitand drive cautiously.
보기3: ③ If you feel tired while driving at night, stop the two-wheeled vehicle on the road side area and get some restbefore you continue.
보기4: ④ Drive rapidly through a crosswalk without traffic lights even if pedestrians are crossing.

문제: 46. Which of the following is appropriate for a motorcyclist?
보기1: ① You can change lanes regularly.
보기2: ② You do not have to wear a helmet on a hot summer day.
보기3: ③ You must slow down when riding over a puddle so as not to splash others.
보기4: ④ You can use the sidewalk when there is traffic congestion.

문제: 47. Which of the following statements describes a safe way to drive a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① When a taxi ahead of you comes to a stop, use caution and slow down, as a passenger might get out of thevehicle.
보기2: ② Carry your mobile phone in your hand while driving so you are able to respond to urgent calls.
보기3: ③ Overtake and pass school buses for children.
보기4: ④ To prevent other vehicles from cutting in front of you, drive closer to the vehicle ahead.

문제: 48. Which of the following is the correct method to yield?
보기1: ① When driving at a low speed, move to the left edge of the road to yield to other drivers.
보기2: ② Apply the brakes immediately if you are being followed by an emergency vehicle.
보기3: ③ Regardless of who has the right of way at an intersection, you should always yield.
보기4: ④ When you encounter a yield sign, yield to drivers on the other road.

문제: 49. Which of the following is a good driving advice?
보기1: ① Close in on the vehicle ahead of you to prevent other drivers from moving into your lane.
보기2: ② If a crosswalk has no traffic lights, the best approach is to drive as fast as you can when there is no onecrossing.
보기3: ③ If you feel tired while driving at night, stop and take some rest where you are before continuing to drive.
보기4: ④ Drive under the speed limit in school zones considering children's safety.

문제: 50. Which of the following is the most appropriate for drivers trying to change lanes or overtake another vehicle?
보기1: ① Change lanes quickly not to disturb others.
보기2: ② It is OK to overtake the vehicle in front of you when that vehicle is trying to overtake another vehicle.
보기3: ③ To overtake another vehicle, do it from its right side.
보기4: ④ Turn on the turning signal first, then change lanes safely when road lines are broken.

문제: 51. Which of the following drivers is most likely to cause a traffic accident?
보기1: ① A driver who focuses only on driving
보기2: ② A driver who repeatedly makes sudden starts and sudden lane changes, and applies brakes suddenly
보기3: ③ A driver who secures a safe distance from other cars or bicycles
보기4: ④ A driver who has a mindset to be patient and yield the right of way

문제: 52. A yield sign is installed before the entrance of an intersection. Which of the following is the correct method topass through?
보기1: ① Pass through slowly.
보기2: ② Pass through without stopping at the stop line.
보기3: ③ Pass through after yielding to another car.
보기4: ④ Turn on the emergency flashers and pass through.

문제: 53. A victim with a minor injury is bleeding. Which of the following best describes the first aid you should provide?
보기1: ① For minor bleeding, put a clean piece of gauze or cloth on the wound and use your hands to apply pressure.
보기2: ② Using a tourniquet, tie the injured part of the body far away from the heart.
보기3: ③ Position the bleeding part so that it is lower than the heart.
보기4: ④ Just drive on, as the injury is only minor.

문제: 54. Which of the following is the most appropriate way to drive safely on the road?
보기1: ① In case of a traffic bottleneck, tailgate the vehicle in front of you.
보기2: ② Drive safely across the crosswalk while pedestrians are still crossing.
보기3: ③ If the traffic light turns yellow, stop in the crosswalk.
보기4: ④ Drive under the speed limit in school zones.

문제: 55. Which of the following is the most considerate driving for pedestrians?
보기1: ① Use the vehicle horn while driving through to alarm the pedestrians.
보기2: ② Two-wheeled vehicles have the right of way over pedestrians on an unlaned road.
보기3: ③ Always drive considerately and defensively for pedestrians.
보기4: ④ When there are no pedestrians crossing, drive by quickly.

문제: 56. You are driving on a two-lane road and a city bus has stopped on the road ahead of you. Which of thefollowing is the safest way to approach?
보기1: ① Keep a safe distance from the bus and quickly pass it.
보기2: ② Speed up and drive in the center of the road.
보기3: ③ Drive on the other side of the road in case a pedestrian comes out from nowhere.
보기4: ④ Stop and wait until the bus moves as it is dangerous to pass a bus.

문제: 57. Which of the following is a safe driving practice?
보기1: ① Sound the horn to let nearby children know that a vehicle is driving by.
보기2: ② Speed up through a railway crossing if the crossing gate is about to close.
보기3: ③ If making a right turn, drive along the right edge of the road at a reduced speed before taking the turn.
보기4: ④ At nighttime, switch your headlights to high beams to alert drivers coming from the opposite direction.

문제: 58. Which of the following is the correct penalty according to the Road Traffic Act for a driver who cannot operate avehicle properly because of fatigue (e.g. falling asleep behind the wheel)?
보기1: ① No penalty
보기2: ② Custody or a fine of up to KRW 100,000
보기3: ③ Custody or a fine of up to KRW 200,000
보기4: ④ Custody or a fine of up to KRW 300,000

문제: 59. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the threshold for the state of intoxication at whichanyone is prohibited from driving?
보기1: ① Blood-alcohol concentration of 0.03 percent or more
보기2: ② Blood-alcohol concentration of 0.06 percent or more
보기3: ③ Blood-alcohol concentration of 0.08 percent or more
보기4: ④ Blood-alcohol concentration of 0.09 percent or more

문제: 60. Which of the following best describes the effect of alcohol on driving?
보기1: ① It reduces the chance of drowsy driving.
보기2: ② It enhances your cognitive ability.
보기3: ③ It enhances your driving ability.
보기4: ④ It reduces your concentration level.

문제: 61. Which of the following statements about brake reaction distance is correct?
보기1: ① Brake reaction distance tends to be longer when the driver is under the influence of alcohol.
보기2: ② When driving in the rain, the stopping distance is shorter than the brake reaction distance.
보기3: ③ Drivers should maintain brake reaction distance to prevent traffic accidents.
보기4: ④ Brake reaction distance is the distance from where the driver applies the brakes upon recognizing danger towhere the vehicle comes to a complete halt.

문제: 62. Which of the following correctly describes the effect of fatigue on driving?
보기1: ① Speed of reaction to surrounding conditions increases.
보기2: ② Vision is reduced, while the field of vision is increased.
보기3: ③ Perception and motor skills deteriorate.
보기4: ④ It is possible to drive in a meticulous and planned manner.

문제: 63. A driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is about to make an unprotected left turn. Which of the following statementsabout safety is correct?
보기1: ① The driver is not allowed to turn left when the lights are green.
보기2: ② The driver may turn left only when the lights are red.
보기3: ③ A two-wheeled vehicle can make left turns regardless of the traffic signal.
보기4: ④ The driver must watch out for vehicles driving straight through the intersection from the opposite direction.

문제: 64. All drivers of two-wheeled vehicles must ( ) at railway crossings before they cross. Which is the correct answerfor ( )?
보기1: ① Slow down
보기2: ② Stop and park
보기3: ③ Make a temporary stop
보기4: ④ Overtake

문제: 65. Which of the following is the criminal penalty standard for driving two-wheeled vehicle with a blood alcoholconcentration of 0.03% or more and less than 0.08%?
보기1: ① Imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to KRW 5 million.
보기2: ② Imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to KRW 10 million.
보기3: ③ Imprisonment for up to 2 years or a fine of up to KRW 10 million.
보기4: ④ Imprisonment for up to 2 years or a fine of up to KRW 20 million.

문제: 66. Which of the following statements about fatigue, overstrain, and drowsy driving is correct?
보기1: ① Driving under monotonous surroundings and very little variety in driving activity can result in drowsy driving,regardless of whether the driver is deprived of sleep.
보기2: ② On a road with few changes and no dangerous situations, a driver's attention improves and the possibility ofdrowsy driving is reduced.
보기3: ③ When the driver gets tired and sleepy, he/she becomes sensitive to dangerous situations.
보기4: ④ When driving under the influence of alcohol, the driver's brain function improves and the possibility of drowsydriving is reduced.

문제: 67. Which of the following correctly describes the impact of fatigue on a driver's body?
보기1: ① The ability to deal with emergency situations is enhanced.
보기2: ② The field of vision is narrowed.
보기3: ③ The time between recognition of a stimulus and response is shortened.
보기4: ④ The driver's sense of judgment is improved.

문제: 68. Which of the following is a good practice for pedestrian safety?
보기1: ① Walk on the left side of the sidewalk
보기2: ② Walk on the right side of the sidewalk
보기3: ③ Walk along the middle of the sidewalk
보기4: ④ Don’t worry which side of the sidewalk you are walking on

문제: 69. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following statements about pedestrian protection is correct?
보기1: ① A cyclist pushing his bicycle is not a pedestrian.
보기2: ② Two-wheeled vehicles always take precedence over pedestrians.
보기3: ③ The commissioner of City/Do police agency can install pedestrian-only lanes for the protection of pedestrians.
보기4: ④ Baby carriages are not allowed on pedestrian-only lanes.

문제: 70. Which of the following persons or groups can pass through the center of a road?
보기1: ① A parade for an important social event
보기2: ② A person riding a large animal such as a horse or a cow
보기3: ③ A person who is cleaning or repairing the road
보기4: ④ A funeral parade with people holding flags or banners

문제: 71. Which of the following best summarizes your duty as a driver to protect pedestrians?
보기1: ① An intoxicated pedestrian who is jaywalking does not have to be protected.
보기2: ② It is okay to interrupt the flow of pedestrians crossing a street where there is traffic control.
보기3: ③ It is acceptable for cars to pass when the green light on the pedestrian’s traffic signal is flashing.
보기4: ④ When making a right turn at an intersection where there is traffic control, you should not interrupt the flow ofpedestrians crossing on their green signal.

문제: 72. Which of the following correctly describes how you should drive when you spot an elderly person crossing theroad?
보기1: ① Continue at your current speed.
보기2: ② Stop your vehicle at a safe distance.
보기3: ③ Drive past him on the other side of the road.
보기4: ④ Sound the horn and come to a sudden stop.

문제: 73. Which of the following statements is correct about when it is safe for a pedestrian to walk on a road where thefootpath and the road are separated?
보기1: ① You can walk on the road if there are many pedestrians.
보기2: ② You can walk on the road if the footpath is closed for construction/repair.
보기3: ③ You can use the road if you are jogging.
보기4: ④ It doesn't matter whether you walk on the footpath or on the road.

문제: 74. While driving through the city at 50 km/h, you spot a pedestrian crossing the road illegally. What is the rightcourse of action for you?
보기1: ① Slam on the brakes and come to a stop.
보기2: ② Estimate the pedestrian's path and drive around him.
보기3: ③ Slow down and turn on the emergency flashers to caution any vehicle behind you before coming to a stop.
보기4: ④ Caution the pedestrian by sounding the horn and increase speed to drive past.

문제: 75. You are trying to make a right turn in an intersection and there is a pedestrian walking on a crosswalk. Which ofthe following is the safest way to approach?
보기1: ① If you think you can make the right turn, do it quickly.
보기2: ② Even though the crosswalk light has turned red, wait until the pedestrian finishes crossing the entire crosswalk.
보기3: ③ Make the turn while avoiding the pedestrian.
보기4: ④ Make the turn since the crosswalk light has turned red.

문제: 76. Which of the following is the safest way to drive through a crosswalk in a school zone with no traffic light?
보기1: ① If there are no pedestrians crossing, drive through slowly.
보기2: ② If there are no pedestrians crossing, drive through as fast as possible.
보기3: ③ Come to a full stop even if there are no pedestrians crossing.
보기4: ④ Use the vehicle horn while driving through to alarm the pedestrians.

문제: 77. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle must ( ) at a crosswalk or intersection when the lights are red. Which of thefollowing is correct?
보기1: ① Slow down
보기2: ② Drive at a reduced speed
보기3: ③ Stop
보기4: ④ Drive through

문제: 78. Which of the following is a safe driving practice?
보기1: ① If an emergency vehicle approaches from behind, increase speed and drive alongside it.
보기2: ② Increase your speed when driving through school zones to prevent accidents.
보기3: ③ Stop if you spot any pedestrians crossing the road illegally.
보기4: ④ Overtake a vehicle up ahead along its right.

문제: 79. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which one of the following is considered apedestrian?
보기1: ① A person using a medical electric wheelchair
보기2: ② A cyclist
보기3: ③ A person using an electric skateboard
보기4: ④ A person using an electric scooter

문제: 80. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following categories is considered thesame as a visually impaired person?
보기1: ① A senior citizen
보기2: ② A hearing-impaired person
보기3: ③ A child
보기4: ④ A person pushing a baby stroller

문제: 81. Which one of the following statements about pedestrians crossing the road is correct?
보기1: ① In an emergency, a pedestrian may choose to cross under the median strip designed to prevent jaywalking.
보기2: ② Pedestrians are not allowed to cross the road where there is no crosswalk.
보기3: ③ People with disabilities may cross the road without having to use a crosswalk or similar facilities.
보기4: ④ Pedestrians may under no circumstances cross immediately in front of or behind a vehicle.

문제: 82. Which of the following safety signs is to be installed mandatorily when a crosswalk cannot be marked becausethe road is in an unfinished condition?
보기1: ① A warning sign to alert people and vehicles passing by
보기2: ② A warning sign to notify drivers of the poor road conditions
보기3: ③ An informative sign indicating the length of the crosswalk
보기4: ④ An informative sign indicating the width of the crosswalk

문제: 83. Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the safest way for a motorcycle driver to cross the roadthrough a crosswalk?
보기1: ① Get off the motorcycle and walk while pushing it.
보기2: ② Proceed as-is, riding the motorcycle.
보기3: ③ Cross while driving the motorcycle slowly.
보기4: ④ Increase the speed of the motorcycle to cross quickly.

문제: 84. According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following is the safest way for a pedestrian to use aroadway where the pedestrian path is not clearly distinguished from the section for cars but has a center line?
보기1: ① Walk along the roadside area.
보기2: ② Walk along any side of the road.
보기3: ③ Walk along the center line.
보기4: ④ Pedestrians must avoid using this road.

문제: 85. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following must a medical electric wheelchair use?
보기1: ① Roadway
보기2: ② Exclusive road for bicycles
보기3: ③ Sidewalk
보기4: ④ Bicycle priority lane

문제: 86. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is traveling on the back road in the center of the city. Which one of thefollowing is the safest way to drive?
보기1: ① Flash the headlights to alert oncoming cars.
보기2: ② Sound the horn to alert others of your vehicle.
보기3: ③ Slow down, as children might suddenly jump into the road.
보기4: ④ Accelerate and drive through the area quickly.

문제: 87. Which of the following is the appropriate way for a motorcyclist to drive?
보기1: ① When traffic conditions are congested, drive between cars.
보기2: ② Of the lanes, drive using the right lane only.
보기3: ③ Use the sidewalk when no pedestrian is using the sidewalk.
보기4: ④ Drive on the roadside area to drive fast.

문제: 88. Which of the following is the safest way to drive when passing over a sidewalk to enter a gas station or theparking lot of a store?
보기1: ① Pass over the sidewalk while flashing your headlights.
보기2: ② Pass over the sidewalk while honking.
보기3: ③ Pass over the sidewalk quickly so as not to get in the way of pedestrians.
보기4: ④ Pass over the sidewalk after making a temporary stop to verify that it is safe to do so.

문제: 89. Which of the following statements about the passage of motor vehicles and horses is correct?
보기1: ① Vehicles and horses should use the lane on the left side of the center line.
보기2: ② Vehicles and horses should use the lane on the right side of the center line.
보기3: ③ In places other than roads, vehicles and horses should use a sidewalk at low speed.
보기4: ④ When entering a designated zone or a place prohibited by a safety sign, vehicles and horses should stoptemporarily before passing.

문제: 90. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following drivers is driving in the safest way?
보기1: ① A driver who is driving carefully next to a pedestrian who is crossing a road that does not have a crosswalk.
보기2: ② A driver who is driving up a steep hill at an increased speed.
보기3: ③ A driver who stops his/her vehicle at an intersection, which does not have traffic lights, as he/she is unable to seewhat is on the left and right sides of the intersection.
보기4: ④ A driver who has spotted the risk of car accident involving a child, and is honking the horn to inform the childof the danger.

문제: 91. At an intersection where there is no traffic control, which of the following motor vehicles should enter theintersection last if there are vehicles intending to enter the intersection at the same time?
보기1: ① A motor vehicle that is coming from a wide road.
보기2: ② A motor vehicle that intends to turn left provided all the roads connected to the intersection have the samewidth.
보기3: ③ A motor vehicle that is coming from a road that is on the right side of the intersection provided all the roadsconnected to the intersection have the same width.
보기4: ④ A motor vehicle that intends to turn right provided all the roads connected to the intersection have the samewidth

문제: 92. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct traffic method for motor vehicles andhorses?
보기1: ① A motor vehicle that intends to turn left at an intersection that does not have traffic lights must give way tomotor vehicles that intend to go straight.
보기2: ② When a motor vehicle stops on a road where the sidewalk and the road are not demarcated, the motor vehiclemust do so at least 50 centimeters toward the center, away from the right side of the road.
보기3: ③ When a motor vehicle signals intention to take a right turn at an intersection, the following motor vehicle mustnot disturb the course of the motor vehicle ahead of it.
보기4: ④ The minimum driving speed on a motor vehicle-only lane is 40 kilometers per hour.

문제: 93. Which of the following correctly describes the type of traffic law violation incurred by the so-called 'tail-biting',that is, an act of disturbing other motor vehicles' course by remaining at an intersection after failing to moveforward even when the traffic signal has changed?
보기1: ① Violation of the methods for passing through Intersections
보기2: ② Violation of temporary stop
보기3: ③ Violation of lane change methods
보기4: ④ Violation of measures for relief of traffic congestion

문제: 94. Which of the following best describes the term ‘safe following distance’ ?
보기1: ① A distance that will allow you to avoid a collision if the vehicle in front of you stops suddenly
보기2: ② The distance to be maintained by a following cyclist to avoid colliding into the rear of the vehicle ahead
보기3: ③ The distance the driver is required to safely step on the brake pedal and bring the vehicle to a stop
보기4: ④ The distance required to identify a dangerous situation, step on the brake pedal, and make the brake startworking

문제: 95. What is the purpose of speed bumps?
보기1: ① To help vehicles conserve fuel
보기2: ② To regulate speeding vehicles
보기3: ③ To reduce traffic volume
보기4: ④ To reduce vehicle speed

문제: 96. Which of the following correctly describes the roadside area?
보기1: ① The roadside area is to be marked with a safety sign for pedestrian safety.
보기2: ② The roadside area, which is intended for cyclists, is installed where roadways and crosswalks are separated.
보기3: ③ The roadside area is to be marked by a safety sign to allow pedestrians to cross the road.
보기4: ④ The roadside area is to be used for travel of two-wheeled vehicles and motorcycles.

문제: 97. Which of the following statements best explains stopping distance?
보기1: ① The distance from the point where the driver first applies the brakes until the point where vehicle comes to acomplete stop
보기2: ② The distance required to avoid collision should the vehicle ahead stop suddenly
보기3: ③ The distance that a vehicle travels from the point at which the driver detects danger and steps on the brakepedal to the point at which the vehicle makes a complete stop
보기4: ④ The distance from where the driver detects danger and applies the brakes until the brakes actually begin toactivate

문제: 98. Which of the following correctly describes the rules related to the speed limits that persons driving two-wheeledvehicles should observe?
보기1: ① The national speed limits don't need to be followed on general roads.
보기2: ② Speed limits indicated by safety signs installed in an area take precedence over legal speed limits.
보기3: ③ Where a legal speed limit and a speed limit indicated by a safety sign differ, either can be followed.
보기4: ④ Legal speed limits take precedence over speed limits indicated by safety signs installed in an area.

문제: 99. You are about to enter an intersection when a police officer signals for you to stop. Which of the followingdescribes the safest way to stop?
보기1: ① Bring the vehicle to a stop right in front of the stop line.
보기2: ② Enter the intersection as quickly you can.
보기3: ③ Turn your emergency flashers on as you enter.
보기4: ④ Enter the intersection slowly.

문제: 100. Which of the following statements about taking a left turn at a congested intersection describes the best drivingpractice?
보기1: ① Follow the vehicle ahead of you into the intersection.
보기2: ② You can enter the intersection if the lights are green.
보기3: ③ You can enter the intersection even during a red light, as long as there is room in the intersection.
보기4: ④ Even if the light is green, do not enter the intersection if it is not enough room.

문제: 101. Which of the following guidelines to stop and park a car is correct?
보기1: ① When parking on a road at night there is no need to follow safety signs.
보기2: ② You may park or stop a car even if it disturbs traffic if a police officer instructs you to do so.
보기3: ③ When parking on a road without clear distinction between roadway and sidewalk, you may park in the safetyzone.
보기4: ④ At a bus stop, you may stop when passengers are getting on and off, but you may not park.

문제: 102. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following places is prohibited for parking?
보기1: ① An outdoor parking space straddling a roadway and a sidewalk in accordance with the parking lot law
보기2: ② A parking space between a roadway and a sidewalk
보기3: ③ An area within 5 meters from the edge of an intersection or the corner of a road
보기4: ④ A parking space in a back road where parking priority is given to the residents

문제: 103. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the punishment for the driver of a two-wheeledvehicle driving at a speed exceeding 80 km/h and 100 km/h or slower?
보기1: ① A fine of up to KRW 300,000 or detention.
보기2: ② A fine of up to KRW 1 million or detention.
보기3: ③ Imprisonment for up to 6 months or a fine of up to KRW 2 million.
보기4: ④ Imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to KRW 5 million.

문제: 104. Which of the following is the driving lane to be used by two-wheeled vehicles on a general road with fourlanes in each direction?
보기1: ① First lane
보기2: ② Left side lane
보기3: ③ Right side lane
보기4: ④ All lanes

문제: 105. Which of the following is the correct method to safely drive up a steep four-lane (two lanes in each direction)road?
보기1: ① Change lanes quickly if a truck ahead blocks your field of vision.
보기2: ② Drive uphill on a high gear.
보기3: ③ Drive along Lane 2 if your vehicle has a low engine displacement.
보기4: ④ Speed up if your vehicle has a high engine displacement.

문제: 106. According to the Road Traffic Act, which out of the following lights should be turned on when a motorcycle isstopped or parked on the road at night due to a breakdown?
보기1: ① Headlight
보기2: ② Sidelight
보기3: ③ Taillight
보기4: ④ License plate light

문제: 107. The motorcycle was driven as follows. Which of the following is not a speed violation under the Road TrafficAct? (Excluding residential, commercial, and industrial areas)
보기1: ① The motorcycle was driven at 70 km/h on a general road with two lanes in each direction. The surface of theroad was frozen.
보기2: ② The motorcycle was driven at 50 km/h on a general road with two lanes in each direction, with less than 20millimeters of snow.
보기3: ③ The motorcycle was driven at 80 km/h on a general road with two lanes in each direction. The road was wet dueto rain.
보기4: ④ The motorcycle was driven at 50 km/h on a general road with two lanes in each direction. There was less than100 meters of visibility due to fog.

문제: 108. Which one of the following is the best method for a two-wheeled vehicle to drive over a speed bump?
보기1: ① Drive around the speed bump through the roadside area.
보기2: ② Accelerate to drive over the speed bump.
보기3: ③ Apply brake quickly and stop before driving over the speed bump.
보기4: ④ Slow down and drive cautiously over the speed bump.

문제: 109. Which one of the following ways of overtaking a vehicle is considered a traffic violation?
보기1: ① Passing the vehicle by crossing a broken white line on a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) uphill road
보기2: ② Checking if the traffic coming from the opposite direction is safe, and passing the vehicle by crossing a solidyellow center line
보기3: ③ Passing the vehicle on the left side on an unpaved road
보기4: ④ Checking if it’s safe and passing a vehicle on a road with a broken yellow line

문제: 110. Which of the following places is allowed for overtaking?
보기1: ① At an intersection
보기2: ② On a national highway with solid yellow lines
보기3: ③ Inside a tunnel
보기4: ④ On a local road with broken yellow lines

문제: 111. Which of the following statements about the method for a two-wheeled vehicle to overtake other vehicles iscorrect?
보기1: ① Overtaking is allowed in tunnels on weekdays.
보기2: ② You can overtake a vehicle ahead along either its left or its right.
보기3: ③ No overtaking is allowed at intersections.
보기4: ④ Overtake a vehicle ahead along its right.

문제: 112. Which of the following statements about the speed limit of one vehicle trying to overtake another vehicle iscorrect?
보기1: ① No speed limit is applied to a vehicle that is overtaking another one.
보기2: ② A vehicle that is overtaking another vehicle can exceed the legal speed limit prescribed for the road by 50%.
보기3: ③ Vehicles are allowed to overtake other vehicles regardless of the speed limit, depending on the driving skill of thedriver.
보기4: ④ Overtaking other vehicles is allowed only when it is performed within the speed limit prescribed for the road.

문제: 113. A driver overtook a vehicle ahead along the left at an intersection. Which of the following offenses has thedriver committed?
보기1: ① Breach of the obligation to yield to a vehicle with due priority
보기2: ② Violation of the rule regarding no-overtaking zone
보기3: ③ Crossing the center line
보기4: ④ Violation of the appropriate method for overtaking

문제: 114. Which one of the following road sections is permitted for a change of lanes?
보기1: ① A section with a broken white line
보기2: ② A section with a solid yellow line
보기3: ③ A section with a broken white line on a bridge
보기4: ④ A section with a solid white line inside a tunnel

문제: 115. Which of the following is the correct method to overtake another vehicle inside a tunnel?
보기1: ① Pass along the left.
보기2: ② Pass with the headlights on.
보기3: ③ Pass while staying within the speed limit.
보기4: ④ Overtaking is not allowed inside a tunnel.

문제: 116. When is a driver allowed to overtake another vehicle?
보기1: ① When the vehicle ahead is overtaking another vehicle
보기2: ② When the vehicle ahead stops or is running slowly to prevent a dangerous situation
보기3: ③ When the vehicle is running next to another vehicle in the left lane
보기4: ④ When the vehicle ahead is running slowly to secure a safe distance from another vehicle

문제: 117. What is the most appropriate method for a motorcycle driver to overtake a car that is moving slowly on atwo-lane road?
보기1: ① Use the roadside area on the right of the lane to pass.
보기2: ② Overtake on the section of road where the yellow dotted centerline is installed, when there are no vehiclescoming from the opposite direction.
보기3: ③ Pass alongside the car if possible.
보기4: ② Overtake on the section of the road where the yellow solid centerline is installed, when there are no vehiclescoming from the opposite direction.

문제: 118. When there is a broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line in the middle of the road, which of thefollowing statements about overtaking is correct?
보기1: ① Overtaking is not allowed on either side.
보기2: ② Overtaking is allowed on the side with the broken yellow line.
보기3: ③ Overtaking is allowed on either side if it’s clear that it’s safe.
보기4: ④ Overtaking is allowed on the side with the solid yellow line.

문제: 119. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct action for a driver when an emergencyvehicle that is being operated for an urgent purpose approaches?
보기1: ① When an emergency vehicle approaches an intersection, it is necessary to temporarily stop on the left edge of the intersection.
보기2: ② When an emergency vehicle approaches an intersection, it is necessary to temporarily stop, avoiding the intersection.
보기3: ③ Drive faster than the emergency vehicle and pass quickly.
보기4: ④ Pause on the spot and wait until the emergency vehicle passes.

문제: 120. Which of the following is the safest action when a fire truck turns on a warning light and sounds a siren while turning right at an intersection?
보기1: ① Avoid driving forward to the intersection and stop temporarily.
보기2: ② Immediately stop at the current position.
보기3: ③ Go slowly and turn right.
보기4: ④ Proceed after passing through the intersection quickly.

문제: 121. You are driving on the road, and you see an emergency vehicle approaching. Which of the following is themost correct course of action that you should take as a driver?
보기1: ① Avoid the emergency vehicle by driving at a higher speed than the legal limit.
보기2: ② Give way to the emergency vehicle so it can overtake and pass.
보기3: ③ Drive normally without any special action.
보기4: ④ The basic principle is to move to the far left side of the road to give way.

문제: 122. Which of the following is considered an emergency vehicle?
보기1: ① A fire truck going to an auto repair center for repairs
보기2: ② An ambulance coming back after transporting an emergency patient
보기3: ③ All vehicles on government duty
보기4: ④ A vehicle designated by the commissioner of City/Do police agency for radio-monitoring work

문제: 123. Which of the following is required for a two-wheeled vehicle transporting a critically ill or injured patient to be classified as an emergency vehicle?
보기1: ① When a permit has been obtained from the local police chief
보기2: ② When the two-wheeled vehicle is driving with headlights and emergency lights on
보기3: ③ When carrying a critically ill or injured patient, your vehicle is considered a de facto emergency vehicle
보기4: ④ When escorted by another vehicle

문제: 124. Which one of the following is an emergency vehicle that may be exempted from liability for causing an accident while responding to an emergency?
보기1: ① An emergency vehicle used by a power supplier in order to prevent risks
보기2: ② A vehicle used for radio monitoring purposes
보기3: ③ A vehicle used by a correctional facility to transport inmates
보기4: ④ A vehicle used for supplying and transporting blood

문제: 125. Which of the following is the fine imposed on a motorcycle driver who violates the duty of concession to an emergency vehicle?
보기1: ① 30,000 won
보기2: ② 40,000 won
보기3: ③ 60,000 won
보기4: ④ 70,000 won

문제: 126. Which of the following is NOT a situation in which an emergency vehicle can use its flashlights in a non-emergency?
보기1: ① A police vehicle on traffic patrol
보기2: ② A vehicle mobilized for a civil defense drill when it is participating in an emergency-related drill
보기3: ③ A vehicle used for telephone repair and maintenance when it is on patrol in order to prevent accidents
보기4: ④ A fire truck on patrol as part of its fire prevention activity

문제: 127. Which of the following is an emergency vehicle that does NOT have to use flashing lights, even in an emergency?
보기1: ① A vehicle used to transport urgent mail or packages
보기2: ② A fire truck
보기3: ③ A vehicle on official security duty
보기4: ④ An ambulance

문제: 128. Which of the following is NOT considered an emergency vehicle?
보기1: ① A vehicle towed by another vehicle for road management
보기2: ② A vehicle led by a police emergency vehicle
보기3: ③ A vehicle led by an army emergency vehicle
보기4: ④ A vehicle transporting a patient in a critical condition

문제: 129. Which of the following are the demerit points incurred by a two-wheeled vehicle driver who violates a signal on the road (not in a protected area) and causes a traffic accident with a serious injury to two persons?
보기1: ① 15 points
보기2: ② 30 points
보기3: ③ 45 points
보기4: ④ 60 points

문제: 130. Which of the following is the correct method to drive when facing a school bus for children on the road without a center line?
보기1: ① If the flasher is turned on indicating that children are getting on or off, just pass by.
보기2: ② If the flasher is turned on indicating that children are getting on or off, go slowly.
보기3: ③ If the flasher is turned on indicating that children are getting on or off, pause and check for safety before passing slowly.
보기4: ④ If the flasher is turned on indicating that children are getting on or off, accelerate and pass quickly.

문제: 131. A school bus for children is driving in the first lane of a four-lane (two lanes in each direction) road while operating its device indicating that children or infants are boarding. Which of the following describes the safest method to drive in this situation?
보기1: ① Do not overtake other vehicles even though the second lane is available.
보기2: ② Take over other vehicles in the second lane.
보기3: ③ Honk the horn to request other vehicles to clear the path.
보기4: ④ Observe the situation on the opposite side of the road, and take over other vehicles through the center line.

문제: 132. Which of the following is the correct explanation of a school zone?
보기1: ① A school zone can be installed in front of a kindergarten or middle school.
보기2: ② The mayor can restrict the passing speed of a school zone.
보기3: ③ Children in a school zone are those under the age of 12.
보기4: ④ It is not possible to limit the speed within 30 km/h if they are in a school zone.

문제: 133. Which of the following is the correct description of a school zone?
보기1: ① A school zone refers to a certain section among roads within 100 meters of the main entrance of an elementary school.
보기2: ② The driving speed of vehicles can be limited to less than 40 km/h when they are in a school zone.
보기3: ③ The walking time of the traffic lights installed in a school zone is based on the maximum walking speed of a child.
보기4: ④ Vehicle traffic may be restricted in a school zone.

문제: 134. Which of the following people does not have the authority to designate school zones?
보기1: ① Mayor of a Special Metropolitan City
보기2: ② Mayor of a Metropolitan City
보기3: ③ Head of a Gun (excluding the head of a Gun within a Metropolitan City)
보기4: ④ A police chief

문제: 135. Which one of the following is NOT a safety facility that can be installed in a school zone?
보기1: ① A crash barrier
보기2: ② A model crosswalk
보기3: ③ A speed bump
보기4: ④ A school zone sign

문제: 136. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following traffic infringements in a school zone is NOT subject to demerit points or a fine as punishment from 8 AM to 8 PM?
보기1: ① An illegal overtake
보기2: ② Traffic light violation
보기3: ③ Speed violation
보기4: ④ Interference to a pedestrian crossing

문제: 137. The following explains the requirements and the principles for management and operation of a school bus for children. Which one is NOT correct?
보기1: ① A school bus for children refers to a vehicle operated for children commuting to school by facilities that provide education for children.
보기2: ② Anyone who operates a school bus for children must keep the report certificate issued by the police chief in the school bus only when allowing children to get on/off the bus and driving them.
보기3: ③ No driver is allowed to overtake a children's school bus that has a sign indicating it carries and drives children or infants on the road, even if it is safe to overtake.
보기4: ④ Anyone who operates a school bus for children must have a guardian in the bus when transporting children or infants on the school bus.

문제: 138. At 9:00 a.m., a two-wheeled vehicle travels at 72 kilometers per hour in a school zone where the speed limit is restricted to 30 kilometers per hour. Which of the following pairings of fine and demerit points is correct?
보기1: ① KRW 80,000 – 60 points
보기2: ② KRW 60,000 – 40 points
보기3: ③ KRW 40,000 – 30 points
보기4: ④ KRW 20,000 – 15 points

문제: 139. A two-wheeled vehicle overtook and passed a school bus for children on the road, despite the bus indicating that it was transporting children. Which of the following pairings of fine and demerit points is correct?
보기1: ① KRW 90,000 – 40 points
보기2: ② KRW 60,000 – 30 points
보기3: ③ KRW 30,000 – 15 points
보기4: ④ KRW 20,000 – 10 points

문제: 140. Which of the following offenses committed by the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle in a school zone at around 10
보기1: ① Breaching the center line
보기2: ② Using a mobile phone while driving
보기3: ③ Stopping/parking in a restricted area
보기4: ④ Failing to change lanes correctly

문제: 141. At 3 PM, a driver of a motorcycle (excluding personal mobility devices) committed an offense by going through the restricted area of a school zone. Which of the following is the correct amount of fine imposed upon the driver according to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① KRW 80,000
보기2: ② KRW 60,000
보기3: ③ KRW 20,000
보기4: ④ KRW 10,000

문제: 142. From ( ) to ( ), a motorcyclist who interferes with a crosswalk in a school zone must pay higher penalties. Which is the correct combination that fits in ( )?
보기1: ① 6 a.m., 6 p.m.
보기2: ② 7 a.m., 7 p.m.
보기3: ③ 8 a.m., 8 p.m.
보기4: ④ 9 a.m., 9 p.m.

문제: 143. What happens if a two-wheeled vehicle driver fails to drive safely in a school zone and causes injury to a child?
보기1: ① The driver will not be charged if he/she arrives at a criminal settlement with the child’s parents.
보기2: ② The driver will be criminally charged and sentenced.
보기3: ③ The driver will not be punished if he/she has a comprehensive insurance policy.
보기4: ④ The driver will not be punished if he/she has a driver's insurance policy.

문제: 144. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is an area designated to protect the elderly from the risk of traffic accidents?
보기1: ① The elderly Protection Zone
보기2: ② Elderly Welfare Zone
보기3: ③ Protection area for older persons
보기4: ④ Safety Zone for older persons

문제: 145. Which of the following is the correct method to hand-signal to other drivers that you are driving at a reduced speed?
보기1: ① Persons driving two-wheeled vehicles are not allowed to make hand signals.
보기2: ② Hold out one arm at a 45-degree angle downward.
보기3: ③ Hold out one arm at a 45-degree angle downward and wave it up and down.
보기4: ④ Hold your left or right arm straight out and wave it back and forth.

문제: 146. Which of the following is NOT an authority the commissioner of City/Do police agency or police chief can exercise in a ’Protection area for older persons’ to protect the elderly?
보기1: ① Prohibit or restrict thoroughfares for horses/vehicles.
보기2: ② Designate and operate a back road as a one-way street.
보기3: ③ Impose a speed limit of 30 km/h for motor vehicles and horses.
보기4: ④ Designate an on-road parking lot for the elderly on a road next to the gate of a house.

문제: 147. Which of the following has the authority to designate a protection area for older persons?
보기1: ① The president of a senior citizens' university
보기2: ② Korean Society of Senior Citizens
보기3: ③ The head of a Gun (excluding the head of a Gun of a Metropolitan City)
보기4: ④ The Commissioner General of the Korean National Police Agency

문제: 148. Which of the following elderly pedestrians has not violated the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① An elderly person who crossed a road that does not have a crosswalk, using the shortest distance
보기2: ② An elderly person who crossed a road by cutting through it instead of using the crosswalk since no motor vehicles were passing
보기3: ③ An elderly person who crossed the road behind a stopped truck
보기4: ④ An elderly person who walked on the left on a sidewalk

문제: 149. At 5 PM, a driver of a motorcycle (excluding personal mobility devices) drove without stopping in a protection area for older persons. Which of the following is the correct amount of fine imposed upon the driver according to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① KRW 100,000 – 40 points
보기2: ② KRW 80,000 – 30 points
보기3: ③ KRW 60,000 – 15 points
보기4: ④ KRW 40,000 – 10 points

문제: 150. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT a specially designated zone?
보기1: ① School Zone
보기2: ② Protection area for older persons
보기3: ③ Protection area persons with disabilities
보기4: ④ Youth Protection Zone

문제: 151. A motorcyclist fails to drive cautiously in a protection area for older persons and causes injury to a senior citizen, who requires two weeks of medical treatment. What happens to the driver?
보기1: ① The driver will not be punished if he/she has a comprehensive insurance policy.
보기2: ② The driver will be criminally charged, regardless of the circumstances.
보기3: ③ The driver is required to reach a settlement with the victim to avoid punishment.
보기4: ④ The driver will not be punished if he/she has a driver's insurance policy only.

보기2: ② KRW 90,000
보기3: ③ KRW 70,000
보기4: ④ KRW 50,000

문제: 153. A motorcyclist belatedly notices a senior citizen crossing a crosswalk without traffic lights for pedestrians, and stops immediately, but still causes an accident, resulting in 2 weeks of medical treatment for the senior citizen. Which of the following statements is correct?
보기1: ① The driver is not at fault as there were no traffic lights for pedestrians.
보기2: ② The driver is subject to civil and criminal liabilities.
보기3: ③ Only the senior citizen who crossed the road will be criminally charged.
보기4: ④ The driver will not be criminally liable if he/she has a comprehensive insurance policy.

문제: 154. A motor vehicle is turning right at an intersection that has traffic lights, but no signals to assist motor vehicles. Which of the following is a case of violation of the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① A driver turning right without interfering the traffic of other vehicles and horses when the traffic light is red.
보기2: ② Turning right without stopping before the stop line when the traffic light is green.
보기3: ③ When the traffic light is yellow, a vehicle turning right should not interfere with the crossing of a pedestrian.
보기4: ④ Stopping and turning right if the vehicle does not interfere with traffic of other vehicles regardless of the traffic light.

문제: 155. Which of the following statements about turning right at an intersection with no traffic lights is correct?
보기1: ① Turn right as fast as possible.
보기2: ② Wait until the vehicles entering the intersection ahead of you pass by, and then take the right turn.
보기3: ③ When a vehicle coming in the opposite direction is taking a left turn, turn right at the same time, with caution.
보기4: ④ You don’t need to worry about other vehicles when you turn right from a wide road onto a narrow one.

문제: 156. Which of the following is the safest method to drive when making a right turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① Switch on the turn signal as you approach the intersection.
보기2: ② If there is a solid white line, take the right turn with caution.
보기3: ③ Turn right while making sure not to obstruct vehicles coming from the left.
보기4: ④ Turn right quickly while checking for other vehicles.

문제: 157. Which of the following is the correct method to make a left/right turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① When making a right turn, quickly pass through the intersection while carefully checking for pedestrians and bicycles that must stop or proceed according to the signal.
보기2: ② When making a left turn, pass through the outside of the intersection's center.
보기3: ③ When making a right turn, reduce the speed in advance while driving along the right edge of the road.
보기4: ④ When making a left turn at an intersection without traffic signals while a pedestrian is crossing the road, quickly pass in front of the pedestrian.

문제: 158. What is the correct method to make a left turn at an intersection without any traffic control?
보기1: ① On general roadways, use the turn signal immediately before the intersection and turn left.
보기2: ② Slow down and follow the center line of the road, and turn left by going around the central island on the outer lane of the intersection.
보기3: ③ You cannot turn left from the outer lane of an intersection, even if it is permitted by the commissioner of City/Do police agency.
보기4: ④ You must slow down. You may or may not stop as you enter, at your discretion.

문제: 159. Which of the following is the safest method to drive when trying to enter and turn left at an intersection that is not in traffic control?
보기1: ① Even if there are other vehicles that have entered the intersection already, proceed slowly and turn left carefully.
보기2: ② Yield to vehicles that are on the broad road.
보기3: ③ You must yield to a vehicle going straight, but you do not have to yield to a vehicle turning right.
보기4: ④ Go slowly along the road's center line beforehand and make a left turn using the outside center of the intersection.

문제: 160. Which one of the following is not a safe method to drive through a roundabout?
보기1: ① Slow down before entering a roundabout.
보기2: ② Stop at the yield line and enter slowly.
보기3: ③ As a vehicle entering the roundabout has the right of way, the vehicle already in the roundabout must yield.
보기4: ④ Drive in an anti-clockwise direction.

문제: 161. Which of the following is the correct method of passing through an intersection?
보기1: ① If the red light is blinking, drive slowly.
보기2: ② When the yellow traffic light is flashing, drive through the intersection as quickly as you can.
보기3: ③ Do not pass ahead of other vehicles at the intersection.
보기4: ④ When you approach the intersection, always use your high-beam headlights.

문제: 162. Which of the following indicates the correct method to drive through an intersection?
보기1: ① When entering an intersection, proceed by shortening your distance from the car in front of you.
보기2: ② When entering an intersection, proceed slowly while honking your horn.
보기3: ③ If the intersection is congested, stop immediately before the stop line, even at a green signal.
보기4: ④ If the signal at the traffic light conflicts with the instruction given by a police officer, follow the traffic light.

문제: 163. Which of the following describes the most correct method of driving through an intersection where there is no traffic control?
보기1: ① Drive slowly when it is not possible to check the left and right sides of the intersection.
보기2: ② A motor vehicle that intends to turn left is given priority over a motor vehicle going straight.
보기3: ③ A motor vehicle that intends to turn right must go before a motor vehicle going straight.
보기4: ④ A motor vehicle coming from a road that is narrower than the other road that it crosses must drive slowly.

문제: 164. Which of the following statements describes the most appropriate way to make a left turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① Drive slowly along the center line, and make a left turn using the inner side of the intersection center.
보기2: ② Drive at high speed along the center line, and take a left turn using the inner side of the intersection center.
보기3: ③ Drive at high speed along the center line, and make a left turn using the outer side of the intersection center.
보기4: ④ Drive slowly along the center line, and make a left turn in a way that is comfortable for the driver.

문제: 165. You are stopped at a red light, and a bicycle is ahead of you. How should you safely resume driving when the light turns green?
보기1: ① Start moving before the bicycle does.
보기2: ② Allow the bicycle enough time and distance to move ahead.
보기3: ③ Move closer to the bicycle.
보기4: ④ Drive fast, honking your horn, so that you can pass the cyclist.

문제: 166. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle stopped over the stop line at an intersection when the light turned red. Which one of the following traffic infringements has he just committed?
보기1: ① Illegal turn
보기2: ② Illegal lane change
보기3: ③ Illegal violation of a thoroughfare in an intersection
보기4: ④ Signal violation

문제: 167. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is about to turn left at an intersection. Which of the following describes the best method?
보기1: ① The motorcyclist stays on the motorcycle and crosses the crosswalk.
보기2: ② The motorcyclist starts by driving toward the right side of the road and then slowly takes a left turn along the edge of the intersection.
보기3: ③ The motorcyclist slows down along the road's median strip and turns left around the inner side of the intersection.
보기4: ④ The motorcyclist can make the left turn from any lane.

문제: 168. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following guides drivers to the correct lane and direction at an intersection?
보기1: ① Center line
보기2: ② Turn line
보기3: ③ Regulatory line
보기4: ④ Instruction line

문제: 169. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT prohibited at an intersection?
보기1: ① Overtaking
보기2: ② Parking
보기3: ③ Stopping
보기4: ④ Slowing down

문제: 170. Which of the following describes the safest method for a motorcyclist to drive through a roundabout?
보기1: ① Stop momentarily before entering the roundabout, and enter when there is no car approaching from the left.
보기2: ② Turn clockwise in the roundabout.
보기3: ③ Cross the traffic island to drive through the roundabout.
보기4: ④ Once in the roundabout, cut in front of other cars frequently.

문제: 171. A two-wheeled vehicle is trying to make a right turn following a truck at an intersection with a bicycle-only lane. Which of the following is the safest way to approach for the two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① Stop and confirm safety first, then quickly make the right turn.
보기2: ② Check both sides and the rear and make the right turn while staying alert on potential blind spots.
보기3: ③ Stay on the right side of the truck and make the turn with the truck while keeping sufficient space.
보기4: ④ Change lanes onto the bicycle-only lane and make the right turn.

문제: 172. Which of the following is not an exclusive lane under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Bus-only lane
보기2: ② Multi-passenger vehicle-only lane
보기3: ③ Two-wheeled vehicle-only lane
보기4: ④ Bicycle-only lane

문제: 173. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following occurs when the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle uses a bicycle-only lane? (There is no sign prohibiting two-wheeled vehicles)
보기1: ① The driver is given an infringement notice with a fine of KRW 40,000.
보기2: ② The driver is given an infringement notice with a fine of KRW 30,000.
보기3: ③ The driver is fined KRW 20,000.
보기4: ④ The driver is not punished.

문제: 174. At a green light, a motorcycle squeezes into a congested intersection but ends up queuing across the intersection, interfering with the traffic. What traffic rule does this behavior violate?
보기1: ① Proper way to cut in
보기2: ② Proper way to pass through an intersection
보기3: ③ Proper way to change lanes
보기4: ④ Traffic signal

문제: 175. Before entering an intersection, the traffic light changes to yellow. Which of the following is the safest driving method?
보기1: ① Accelerate and enter the intersection quickly.
보기2: ② Stop immediately before the stop line.
보기3: ③ Change into an empty lane and continue driving.
보기4: ④ As cars could be coming from other directions, sound the horn and continue driving.

문제: 176. After entering an intersection, the traffic light changes to yellow. Which of the following is the safest driving course of action?
보기1: ① If the vehicle ahead stops, change lanes to the left and continue driving.
보기2: ② Stop immediately at the intersection.
보기3: ③ Quickly finish driving through the intersection.
보기4: ④ Use the horn to caution any bicycle ahead to stay out of the way.

문제: 177. Which of the following statements describes the correct method to pass through an intersection where the red light is flashing?
보기1: ① Slow down and continue driving.
보기2: ② Stop momentarily before entering the intersection, check for safety, and continue driving.
보기3: ③ Continue driving.
보기4: ④ Sound the horn and drive quickly through the intersection.

문제: 178. Which of the following statements about traffic signals is correct?
보기1: ① When the yellow light is flashing– all vehicles must stop before the stop line and not continue further.
보기2: ② Red light
보기3: ③ Green arrow
보기4: ④ Yellow light

문제: 179. Which of the following is the safest method to drive when entering an intersection with signals?
보기1: ① Enter quickly by increasing speed.
보기2: ② Enter while maintaining your distance from the car in front.
보기3: ③ Enter by narrowing your distance from the car in front.
보기4: ④ Enter while paying attention to the car that is following you.

문제: 180. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following people is NOT subject to the obligation to follow traffic signals or instructions?
보기1: ① A pedestrian crossing at a crosswalk with a streetlight
보기2: ② The driver of a cultivator driving on the road
보기3: ③ A farmer riding on a horse carriage on an unpaved road
보기4: ④ A passenger next to the driver's seat in a motor vehicle operating on a road

문제: 181. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a space where a motor vehicle can stop?
보기1: ① 7 meters away from safety zones
보기2: ② 7 meters away from bus stations
보기3: ③ 7 meters away from corners of streets
보기4: ④ 7 meters away from a crosswalk

문제: 182. Which of the following statements about bicycle traffic is incorrect?
보기1: ① Bicycles are classified as vehicles.
보기2: ② In principle, you cannot ride a bicycle on pedestrian walks.
보기3: ③ Cyclists must dismount and push their bicycles when crossing a crosswalk.
보기4: ④ Cyclists are allowed to ignore traffic signals at intersections.

문제: 183. Which of the following is the correct action to take when the brake light of a car in front is turned on?
보기1: ① Honk the horn.
보기2: ② Slow down.
보기3: ③ Change lanes.
보기4: ④ Overtake.

문제: 184. Which of the following is an area where you must drive slowly according to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① An intersection with traffic control
보기2: ② A curved section of a road
보기3: ③ When going uphill on a slope
보기4: ④ In a tunnel with heavy traffic

문제: 185. A driver needs to cross a sidewalk to enter a building. Which of the following describes the safest way to drive?
보기1: ① If there is no pedestrian on the sidewalk, proceed quickly.
보기2: ② Turn on the turn signal and enter immediately.
보기3: ③ Come to a temporary stop and check both sides, and cross the sidewalk in a manner that does not interfere with the flow of pedestrians.
보기4: ④ Honk your horn to let people know that you are crossing the sidewalk, and enter the parking lot quickly.

문제: 186. In which of the following situations is a two-wheeled vehicle allowed to cross a railway crossing?
보기1: ① The crossing gate of the railway crossing is closed.
보기2: ② The crossing gate of the railway crossing is about to close.
보기3: ③ The railway crossing has an alarm that is sounding.
보기4: ④ The signal indicates you can cross.

문제: 187. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle must ( ) when an emergency vehicle approaches. Which answer fits in ( )?
보기1: ① Slow down
보기2: ② Yield the right of way
보기3: ③ Drive fast
보기4: ④ Stop immediately in the lane

문제: 188. If you have pulled over to the roadside and want to return to traffic, which of the following is the safest method to do so?
보기1: ① Move to the middle of the road without using the turn signal.
보기2: ② Switch on the turn signal to enter the road, and switch off the signal before you are done with changing lanes.
보기3: ③ Switch on the turn signal and enter the road slowly.
보기4: ④ Enter the road immediately after you switch on the turn signal.

문제: 189. Which of the following statements about road surface markings is correct?
보기1: ① A broken white line indicates that you can change directions.
보기2: ② A solid white line indicates that you can change directions when it is safe to do so.
보기3: ③ A broken yellow line (center line) indicates that you can change directions but cannot overtake.
보기4: ④ A solid yellow line (center line) restricts change of direction.

문제: 190. The following are different methods to signal when changing lanes. Which is the most appropriate?
보기1: ① If you change lanes without signaling, it is not a violation of traffic laws as long as it does not interfere with the movement of other vehicles.
보기2: ② Even after changing lanes, you should leave the signal on for some time to notify other drivers of your intent.
보기3: ③ Signal must be switched on only when changing lanes, and the signal should be switched off while a turn is being made.
보기4: ④ Signal must remain switched on until the change of lane is complete, and should be switched off immediately after changing lanes.

문제: 191. Which of the following explanations is correct?
보기1: ① White dotted lanes are meant to prohibit cutting in.
보기2: ② Lanes with solid white lines should be marked (installed) in sections of the road where changing lanes is acceptable.
보기3: ③ Lanes with solid white lines indicate bus-only lanes.
보기4: ④ Lanes with solid white lines are for restricting changes of course.

문제: 192. Which of the following describes the correct method of stopping a car on a road with a separate sidewalk for pedestrians?
보기1: ① Stop on the right edge of the roadway.
보기2: ② Stop on the sidewalk.
보기3: ③ Stop on the left edge of the roadway.
보기4: ④ Stop in a lane, in a convenient area.

문제: 193. The following statements are about yellow dotted lines on the edge of roads. Which is the most correct?
보기1: ① You can park or stop on the edge marked with yellow dotted lines.
보기2: ② Parking is prohibited on edges marked with yellow dotted lines, but you may stop.
보기3: ③ Parking is allowed on edges marked with yellow dotted lines, but you may not stop.
보기4: ④ Both parking and stopping are prohibited on edges marked with yellow dotted lines.

문제: 194. On which of the following roads can a two-wheeled vehicle make a U-turn?
보기1: ① A road with a solid yellow line in the center
보기2: ② A road with a solid white line in the center
보기3: ③ A road with a broken white line in the center
보기4: ④ A road with a solid blue line in the center

문제: 195. Which of the following is the most appropriate method to cross a railroad crossing?
보기1: ① Stop in front of the railroad crossing, make sure it is safe, and then cross.
보기2: ② If no train is passing, cross quickly.
보기3: ③ When the crossing gate begins to descend, cross quickly.
보기4: ④ Even if there is a traffic light, you must come to a stop before crossing.

문제: 196. Which of the following drivers best conform to traffic signals?
보기1: ① A driver who tailgates the vehicle in front of him/her.
보기2: ② A driver who drives according to the traffic signal on the other side of the road.
보기3: ③ A driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is not obliged to comply with the reversible lane signs.
보기4: ④ All drivers must obey the traffic signals.

문제: 197. If the signal at the traffic light before entering the intersection is yellow, which of the following is the most correct course of action?
보기1: ① Turn left while driving slowly.
보기2: ② Make a U-turn slowly.
보기3: ③ Increase the speed and quickly cross the stop line.
보기4: ④ Stop right before the stop line.

문제: 198. Which of the following statements related to taking a left turn at an intersection is good driving advice?
보기1: ① You need not worry about vehicles coming straight from the opposite direction.
보기2: ② You need to worry only about vehicles coming from the opposite direction and turning to their right.
보기3: ③ Check for vehicles moving in the same direction and turning to their right.
보기4: ④ Pay attention to vehicles moving in the same direction that are also taking a left turn.

문제: 199. Which of the following statements about the center line on a road is incorrect?
보기1: ① The purpose of the center line is to clarify the rules of vehicle and horse thoroughfare.
보기2: ② A solid yellow line or a broken yellow line can be used.
보기3: ③ A median strip or crash barrier can be installed.
보기4: ④ A center line cannot be installed on a reversible road for vehicles.

문제: 200. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following statements regarding a safe zone is not correct?
보기1: ① A safe zone is a section of the road marked with a safety sign for pedestrians crossing the road, or for the safety of vehicles moving in the area.
보기2: ② A safe zone is marked either in yellow or white.
보기3: ③ Safe zones are located in areas where there are obstacles.
