보기4: ④ A safe zone is a section of the road marked with a safety sign for pedestrians crossing the road.

문제: 201. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle driving on a reversible vehicle road sees a red X flashing over his/her lane. What is the safest method to drive?
보기1: ① Slow down and continue driving.
보기2: ② Stop temporarily, check for safety, and continue driving.
보기3: ③ Change quickly out of that lane.
보기4: ④ Change out of that lane momentarily and return to it later.

문제: 202. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is NOT a category of traffic light?
보기1: ① Traffic lights for two-wheeled vehicles
보기2: ② Traffic lights for vehicles
보기3: ③ Traffic lights for bicycles
보기4: ④ Traffic lights for buses

문제: 203. Which of the following is NOT an offense for which the driver or the business owner may be fined if the act is proven by video recording?
보기1: ① Not adhering to protection of pedestrians
보기2: ② Violating rules of driving in an intersection
보기3: ③ Use of a bus-only lane
보기4: ④ Operating video display while driving

문제: 204. Which of the following best describes the cause and prevention of aquaplaning?
보기1: ① Controlling the steering wheel has a minimal impact during aquaplaning.
보기2: ② The newer the tires, the lower the chance of aquaplaning.
보기3: ③ The chance of aquaplaning rises as the contact area between the tires and as the road surface reduces.
보기4: ④ It is critical to maintaining vehicle speed when raining to prevent aquaplaning.

문제: 205. Which of the following is the most correct about the safe operation of two-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① One shall use the sidewalk when the road is blocked due to traffic congestion.
보기2: ② One shall maintain the same speed when passing speed bumps, and drive along the roadside area, where there are no speed bumps.
보기3: ③ One shall reduce the speed when it is raining.
보기4: ④ One can drive at a high speed on curved roads.

문제: 206. What is the safest method to respond to earthquakes?
보기1: ① If an earthquake occurs, drive quickly to get away from the location of the earthquake.
보기2: ② Make sure to allow enough distance from the car in front, and stop on the right side of the street.
보기3: ③ If you must evacuate from your car, keep your car’s engine on.
보기4: ④ Continue to proceed regardless of the earthquake.

문제: 207. When should a vehicle reduce its speed to 80% of the prescribed speed limit?
보기1: ① When visibility is less than 100 meters due to heavy snow or heavy rain
보기2: ② When the road surface is wet due to rain
보기3: ③ When the road surface is frozen due to snow
보기4: ④ When there is more than 20 mm of snow piled up on the road

문제: 208. Which of the following is the safest method to drive when passing through a foggy area where you can't see 70 meters ahead?
보기1: ① Turn on the headlights and quickly pass through the foggy area.
보기2: ② Turn on the headlights and emergency flashers and go slowly.
보기3: ③ Turn on the emergency flashers only and accelerate.
보기4: ④ Drive right behind the vehicle in front of you.

문제: 209. Which one of the following describes the best method to drive through a busy intersection without traffic lights?
보기1: ① Sound the horn and drive through quickly.
보기2: ② Turn on the emergency flashers, and drive through along the edge of the intersection.
보기3: ③ Since vehicles inside the intersection have the right of way, enter the intersection first.
보기4: ④ Before entering the intersection, stop momentarily and drive through while checking for safety.

문제: 210. A two-wheeled vehicle is following a cultivator on a road with a single lane in each direction, marked with solid yellow lines in the center. What is the safest method to drive?
보기1: ① Since the cultivator is a slow-moving vehicle, drive past quickly along its right.
보기2: ② Since a two-wheeled vehicle is faster than a cultivator, overtake it quickly across the center line.
보기3: ③ Sound the horn and drive along the center line.
보기4: ④ Maintain a safe following distance and follow the cultivator.

문제: 211. An exemplary driver explains a safe driving method to a novice driver. Which of the following is correct?
보기1: ① When passing through an intersection where there is no traffic control in busy traffic, it is advisable to pass slowly.
보기2: ② If the yellow light is on before you enter an intersection, you are allowed to pass.
보기3: ③ If there are solid white lines on the bridge, you may only focus on keeping the speed limit.
보기4: ④ You're not supposed to overtake a slow-moving vehicle following the instructions of police officials.

문제: 212. You are driving on a four-lane road and it’s raining. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the safest way to drive in this situation? (Excluding when driving in residential, commercial, and industrial regions)
보기1: ① Because your free running distance shortens on rainy days, it is OK to drive at 70 kph.
보기2: ② Because your braking distance shortens on rainy days, it is OK to drive at a regular speed of 80 kph.
보기3: ③ Because it bears no relation to safe driving, it is OK to drive at 90 kph.
보기4: ④ You must reduce speed and drive at 60 kph.

문제: 213. You are driving on a four-lane road with an 80 kph speed limit covered with less than 10 mm of snow, and it's foggy, which limits visibility up to 50 m. Which of the following is the most proper way to drive?
보기1: ① Reduce speed by 20% from the speed limit.
보기2: ② Reduce speed by 30% from the speed limit.
보기3: ③ Reduce speed by 40% from the speed limit.
보기4: ④ Reduce speed by 50% from the speed limit.

문제: 214. Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a correct explanation of changing course?
보기1: ① Since a bridge surface is a dangerous place, there are many cases where changing course is restricted by a solid white line.
보기2: ② Places that need to restrict changing course are marked with white dotted lanes.
보기3: ③ At places where changing course is prohibited, it should not be done even if it is difficult to pass due to obstacles coming from road construction, etc.
보기4: ④ If you change your course safely, it is not a violation of the law even if it is done in place where it is prohibited to change course.

문제: 215. Which is the most appropriate reason for using the engine brake when driving on a long downhill course?
보기1: ① To prevent the engine from overheating
보기2: ② To save fuel
보기3: ③ To prevent fading of the braking system
보기4: ④ To prevent reducing the vehicle’s lifetime

문제: 216. Which of the following is the safest way to drive in the area near the summit of a hill?
보기1: ① Keep close to the vehicle ahead of you and drive quickly.
보기2: ② Opposite lanes do not matter. Focus on your lane when driving over the hill.
보기3: ③ Because you cannot see the opposite lanes well, maintain caution when driving over the hill.
보기4: ④ Higher gear is better than lower gears.

문제: 217. Which of the following is the safest driving practice when driving on a road with sharp curves?
보기1: ① Turn the steering wheel quickly on a sharply curved road, reduce the speed by applying the brake, and proceed.
보기2: ② Reduce your speed sufficiently on a straight section of the road before entering the curved section.
보기3: ③ As a road with sharp curves is dangerous, you should accelerate to pass through quickly.
보기4: ④ If the road with sharp curves does not have a 'no passing' sign, pass the car in front of you quickly.

문제: 218. Which of the following is the best method to drive in a storm or a gust of wind?
보기1: ① Tightly hold onto the wheel with both hands and stay in your lane.
보기2: ② Accelerate regardless of the wind.
보기3: ③ Park near a sign, traffic light, or a tree.
보기4: ④ There is little danger of wind in mountainous areas, bridges, or near tunnels.

문제: 219. You are following a vehicle ahead on a roadway with a single lane in each direction, and are about to pass the highest point on a hill. What is the safest method to drive?
보기1: ① Since you cannot see ahead, stay close to the median strip and keep following the vehicle ahead.
보기2: ② Since you cannot see ahead or see the oncoming traffic, use caution and follow the vehicle ahead slowly.
보기3: ③ Since you cannot see what is going on ahead if you keep following the vehicle in front of you, overtake the vehicle quickly.
보기4: ④ Use the vehicle ahead as a shield, and drive closer to the vehicle.

문제: 220. Which of the following is the most proper way to drive through a four-lane tunnel?
보기1: ① Even though you are in the tunnel, the white broken line means you can change lanes.
보기2: ② Overtaking is not prohibited in tunnels. If the vehicle in front of you is too slow, you can overtake that vehicle.
보기3: ③ It is darker in tunnels, so tailgate the vehicle in front of you.
보기4: ④ If the vehicle in front of you is driving slowly and there are only a few vehicles in the tunnel, you can overtake.

문제: 221. According to the Road Traffic Act, the commissioner of a city or provincial police agency or the chief of a police station may, if deemed necessary, limit the speed of motor vehicles and horses to ( ) on a pedestrians-first road to ensure pedestrian safety. Which of the following best fills the parentheses?
보기1: ① 20 km
보기2: ② 30 km
보기3: ③ 40 km
보기4: ④ 50 km

문제: 222. Which of the following statements best explains a 'tunnel section' on a general roadway in the winter?
보기1: ① It freezes only in extreme cold.
보기2: ② The starting and ending points are in contact with the ground, and therefore do not freeze.
보기3: ③ Geothermal heat keeps the tunnel warmer than the outside, which prevents freezing of the inside of the tunnel.
보기4: ④ The entry and exit points of the tunnel are especially dangerous.

문제: 223. On a two-lane uphill road, a truck is driving slowly followed by a two-wheeled vehicle. Which of the following is the safest way for the driver of the two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① Follow the truck while maintaining a safe distance.
보기2: ② Because a two-wheeled vehicle is fast, overtake the truck from its right side.
보기3: ③ Follow the truck while crossing the center line to get a clearer view of the road.
보기4: ④ Quickly overtake the truck since it is driving too slow.

문제: 224. Which of the following explanations about glare from other vehicles’ headlights that occurs at night is correct?
보기1: ① The glare from headlights mainly affects drivers with poor vision.
보기2: ② The glare from headlights only occurs on expressways.
보기3: ③ The glare from headlights mainly occurs from vehicles in the same direction.
보기4: ④ Frequent exposure to glare from headlights increases the risk of an accident.

문제: 225. Which of the following is the correct method to avoid the glare from the headlights of an oncoming vehicle at night?
보기1: ① Do not look directly at the headlights, but at the road directly in front of your vehicle.
보기2: ② Do not look directly at the headlights, but to the right edge of the road.
보기3: ③ Squint your eyes and look at the road directly in front of your vehicle.
보기4: ④ Squint your eyes and look to your left edge.

문제: 226. Which of the following is the safest method of driving at night?
보기1: ① A driver does not have to turn on the headlights even though the sun has set and the weather is getting darker as long as the driver's view is clear.
보기2: ② A driver shall drive slowly, as human vision deteriorates at night and the driver's view becomes narrower.
보기3: ③ A driver shall drive close to the motor vehicle in front so that the headlights can reach the rear of the car in front.
보기4: ④ A driver shall keep his/her eyes focused on a short distance ahead, in order to identify obstacles easily.

문제: 227. Which of the following is not true about illuminated/reflective road signs?
보기1: ① They are installed in places where nighttime car accidents are common or potentially common.
보기2: ② The background color can be changed to matte black.
보기3: ③ The color of caution texts and symbols can be changed to blue.
보기4: ④ The color of instructional texts and symbols can be changed to white.

문제: 228. Where does ‘evaporation’, a phenomenon in which pedestrians or objects on roads vanish temporarily from the driver’s sight, occur most frequently?
보기1: ① Edge of the opposite lane
보기2: ② Right side of your lane
보기3: ③ Around the centerline of the road
보기4: ④ Right edge of the road

문제: 229. Which of the following statements about nighttime driving of two-wheeled vehicles is incorrect?
보기1: ① Drivers of two-wheeled vehicles can judge the distance more accurately than during daytime.
보기2: ② Because it is more difficult to detect an obstacle ahead, drivers of two-wheeled vehicles should drive at a much slower speed than during daytime.
보기3: ③ On remote mountainous roads, it is advisable to turn on high-beam headlights so that the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle can be easily spotted by other motorists.
보기4: ④ If the headlights of vehicles ahead are moving up and down, understand that the road conditions are poor and use caution.

문제: 230. Which one of the following statements about nighttime driving is incorrect?
보기1: ① Pedestrians walking along the edge of the road are not easy to spot.
보기2: ② Drivers tend to detect bicycles traveling along the edge of the road rather late.
보기3: ③ Headlights of oncoming large vehicles can easily blind drivers.
보기4: ④ At night, visibility is low, reducing the possibility of traffic accidents.

문제: 231. Which of the following is not true about preventing and handling roadkill at nighttime?
보기1: ① Reduce speed when driving on roads that are prone to wildlife appearance.
보기2: ② When you have encountered a water deer, turn on the high-beam headlights to scare it away.
보기3: ③ You must not touch an animal carcass since it may be infested with diseases.
보기4: ④ Report any accidents involving wildlife to the respective road management agency.

문제: 232. At night, a two-wheeled vehicle is traveling on a general road with four lanes in each direction. Which of the following describes the best method to drive?
보기1: ① Since there are no vehicles on the road, it is safe to drive in Lane 2.
보기2: ② Drive in Lane 1 to make it easier for other motorists to detect you at night.
보기3: ③ Because the likelihood of a collision is high at night, drive along the outer side of the roadside area.
보기4: ④ Drive in the designated Lane 4 and maintain a safe following distance from the vehicle ahead.

문제: 233. A two-wheeled vehicle is traveling in an alley at night. Which of the following describes the best method to drive?
보기1: ① As minor collisions are frequent in alleyways, you should drive through the alleyway quickly at night.
보기2: ② If the intersection of the alleyway is quiet, use your high-beam headlights as you quickly drive through the alleyway.
보기3: ③ Since you can detect oncoming vehicles by their headlights, drive through the alleyway quickly if you do not see any lights.
보기4: ④ Slow down, as pedestrians can emerge out of nowhere in an alleyway.

문제: 234. Which of the following lights should a two-wheeled vehicle turn on when it intends to idle or park on a road at nighttime?
보기1: ① Headlights
보기2: ② Sidelights
보기3: ③ License plate lights
보기4: ④ Daytime running lights

문제: 235. In the event of a fire caused by a traffic accident, which of the following statements describes the most appropriate action to take?
보기1: ① You must participate in the rescue activities when a rescue team arrives.
보기2: ② You may smoke a cigarette to relieve tension.
보기3: ③ If the accident was a collision involving a vehicle carrying dangerous substances, you should get far away from where the accident occurred.
보기4: ④ You should never touch the injured even when a fire has started.

문제: 236. Which of the following is the appropriate action when driving a motorcycle and causing an accident involving a parked vehicle without occupants?
보기1: ① If you take necessary measures for smooth communication on the road, you do not need to leave your contact information.
보기2: ② You must provide your name and phone number to the owner of the vehicle that was involved in the accident.
보기3: ③ In the case of an accident in an apartment complex, it is not necessary to provide the contact information to the owner because it is not a road.
보기4: ④ There is no need to take measures to prevent danger in places other than the road.

문제: 237. Which of the following is the most inappropriate action to take when the engine of a motorcycle is suddenly turned off while driving?
보기1: ① Quickly move to a safe place on the edge of the road and check it.
보기2: ② To prevent a collision with the vehicle behind, a sign of a broken vehicle should be installed.
보기3: ③ Turn on the emergency flashers, and try to restart the engine at the same spot.
보기4: ④ Use the emergency parking lot to stop in a tunnel, and report the case by using an emergency phone.

문제: 238. Which of the following is the most urgent first aid measure that you must take in a road accident?
보기1: ① Move the injured to a safe place in order to check the state of injury.
보기2: ② When giving first aid to an injured person, do CPR first.
보기3: ③ Before administering first aid to the injured, check the damage to the car first.
보기4: ④ Check if the injured person is conscious, and perform chest compressions first if he/she is unconscious.

문제: 239. If a person injured in a traffic accident is unconscious, what type of first aid should be administered for the victim?
보기1: ① Report the traffic accident to an insurance company
보기2: ② Chest compressions
보기3: ③ Move the injured person quickly to a safe place
보기4: ④ Hemostasis of the bleeding area

문제: 240. While riding a two-wheeled vehicle at high speed, you notice that its brake does not seem to work. Which of the following is the best action to take?
보기1: ① Turn off the engine immediately and reduce speed.
보기2: ② Shift into low gear, and jump off the vehicle.
보기3: ③ Turn the wheel abruptly to turn and reduce your speed.
보기4: ④ Apply the engine brake by taking your hands off the throttle grip and change gears in the correct order to reduce speed.

문제: 241. Which of the following is not true about road icing during the winter season?
보기1: ① Road icing occurs when the surface of the road is coated with a thin layer of ice.
보기2: ② Road icing is more common in areas with lower temperatures, such as on a bridge, tunnel entrance, and shaded parts of a road.
보기3: ③ Road icing is more common on concrete roads than on asphalt.
보기4: ④ Ice melts slower on concrete roads than on asphalt.

문제: 242. While riding a two-wheeled vehicle, its engine suddenly shuts down and the vehicle stalls on the road. Which one of the following is the best action to take?
보기1: ① Leave the vehicle where it is and promptly evacuate yourself.
보기2: ② Leave the emergency flashers on. Stay where you are and alert other motorists of the danger.
보기3: ③ To prevent a secondary accident, take necessary actions and move to a safe place.
보기4: ④ Try repeatedly to turn the engine on.

문제: 243. Which of the following is not true about potholes (holes in a road surface)?
보기1: ① Four-wheeled vehicles are more prone to pothole-related accidents than two-wheeled vehicles.
보기2: ② Reduce speed when driving nearby potholes to prevent accidents.
보기3: ③ If your vehicle ran over a pothole with significant impact force, visit a repair shop.
보기4: ④ Potholes are more common on asphalt roads than on concrete ones.

문제: 244. Which of the following is NOT a correct description of how to operate the brakes of two-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① Two-wheeled vehicles can easily flip if the brake of the front tire is activated abruptly.
보기2: ② Two-wheeled vehicles can easily slide to the side if the brake of the rear tire is activated abruptly.
보기3: ③ It is dangerous to activate the front and rear tire brakes of a two-wheeled vehicle at the same time.
보기4: ④ When using the brake of the rear tire, the driver should gently step on the center of brake pedal with the tip of the right foot.

문제: 245. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following constitutes an act of 'driving'?
보기1: ① When a driverless vehicle moves on a downhill road due to an incorrect parking condition
보기2: ② When a person without a driver’s license parks at an underground parking lot in an apartment where access is controlled
보기3: ③ When a person parks a car in a motel parking lot in a situation where driving is difficult due to use of drugs
보기4: ④ When a person drags a 125 cc motorcycle on a city road with both hands holding the steering wheel in a situation where the engine has switched off

문제: 246. Which of the following is a place where you should stop while driving?
보기1: ① Near a curve on a road
보기2: ② A steep descent
보기3: ③ Near the top of a slope
보기4: ④ An intersection with no traffic control and heavy traffic

문제: 247. According to the Road Traffic Act, in which of the following circumstances are you required to come to a stop?
보기1: ① An intersection without a traffic control officer, where traffic to the left and right cannot be checked
보기2: ② An intersection where the lights have turned green
보기3: ③ In a busy bridge or tunnel
보기4: ④ Near a bent road or the pick of a slope

문제: 248. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is a place where drivers are required to temporarily stop?
보기1: ① Inside tunnels or on bridges
보기2: ② Busy intersections with no traffic lights
보기3: ③ Steep downhill roads
보기4: ④ Curved roads

문제: 249. Which of the following are you obliged to report to the police station without delay if a traffic accident occurs?
보기1: ① All the items inside the car and the degree of damage
보기2: ② Traffic conditions and directions to the accident site
보기3: ③ Number of casualties and the severity of their injuries
보기4: ④ Occupation of the casualties and their family relations

문제: 250. In which of the following situations is it acceptable to overtake another vehicle?
보기1: ① You want to overtake a slow-moving truck in a tunnel where the road is marked with solid white lines.
보기2: ② You want to overtake a cultivator at an intersection.
보기3: ③ You want to overtake a horse-drawn carriage on a bridge where the road is marked with solid white lines.
보기4: ④ You want to overtake a forklift on a road with broken yellow lines as its median strip.

문제: 251. The followings are various explanations of the 'white solid lane' road markings. Which is correct?
보기1: ① As it is intended to restrict changing course, no vehicle must change its course in a section marked with the white solid line.
보기2: ② As it signifies a parking prohibition, all vehicles can change their course in a section marked with the white solid line.
보기3: ③ As it signifies a bus-only lane, buses can change their course in a section marked with the white solid line.
보기4: ④ Two-wheeled vehicles or bicycles can change their course in a section marked with the white solid line.

문제: 252. What is the penalty for a two-wheeled vehicle driver who has exceeded the speed limit by 100 kph? (Firstviolation)
보기1: ① Imprisonment with labor for not exceeding 1 year or a fine not exceeding KRW 3 million
보기2: ② Imprisonment with labor for not exceeding 6 months, a fine not exceeding KRW 2 million, or detention
보기3: ③ A fine not exceeding KRW 1 million or detention
보기4: ④ A fine not exceeding KRW 300,000 or detention

문제: 253. According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following is NOT a rule drivers of two-wheeled vehicles should comply with?
보기1: ① Do not sound the horn repeatedly without any justifiable reason.
보기2: ② Stop when you see children playing in the road.
보기3: ③ Do not increase your speed excessively without any justifiable reason.
보기4: ④ Do not have another passenger in the back seat when you travel on your two-wheeled vehicle.

문제: 254. Which of the following is the punishment for a motorcycle driver who does not ensure that his or her passengers are wearing life protection equipment?
보기1: ① Fine of 20,000 won (Demerit points may be imposed.)
보기2: ② Fine of 30,000 won (Demerit points may be imposed.)
보기3: ③ Fine of 20,000 won
보기4: ④ Fine of 30,000 won

문제: 255. According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following is NOT subject to legal action by police?
보기1: ① The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who parks his/her motorcycle on the crosswalk
보기2: ② A motorcyclist traveling at night without headlights and/or taillights on
보기3: ③ The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle driving without protective gear
보기4: ④ A driver with a Class II driver’s license for ordinary motor vehicles operating a motorcycle

문제: 256. The following examples describe driving behaviors of two-wheeled vehicle drivers and motorcyclists that are subject to the regulations of the Road Traffic Act. Which of the following is subject to noticed disposition?
보기1: ① When a driver operates a two-wheeled vehicle with 0.1 percent of blood-alcohol concentration
보기2: ② When a driver operates a two-wheeled vehicle after his/her driver's license has been cancelled
보기3: ③ When a motorcyclist operates his/her vehicle on a automobile road
보기4: ④ When a motorcyclist violates the obligation to protect pedestrians during operation

문제: 257. The following are crosswalks with no traffic light. At which crosswalk should a two-wheeled vehicle come to a full stop regardless of pedestrians crossing?
보기1: ① A crosswalk in a school zone
보기2: ② A crosswalk in a priority zone for persons with disabilities
보기3: ③ A crosswalk in a silver zone
보기4: ④ A crosswalk in a university district

문제: 258. Which of the following is NOT a desirable action in compliance with the law for the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① When you are going at a slow speed, it is advisable to go to the edge of the road at the right and give way to other vehicles.
보기2: ② You must quickly give way to an emergency vehicle that is following you.
보기3: ③ Since vehicles that enter an intersection have the right of way, it is desirable to enter the intersection before others do.
보기4: ④ When travelling on a road with a Yield sign, always give way to vehicles on other roads.

문제: 259. Which one of the following is NOT a driving habit or behavior that the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle must avoid in the interests of safety?
보기1: ① Stay very close to the vehicle ahead so that other vehicles cannot cut in front of you.
보기2: ② Always attempt to go ahead of others to ensure that the traffic is smooth.
보기3: ③ The moment you consider other drivers, you will lag behind.
보기4: ④ Even if the traffic lights for pedestrians have changed, you must still look left and right before you continue.

문제: 260. Which of the following lists the correct order of measures to be taken in the event of a traffic accident?
보기1: ① Secure the evidence at the scene → Report to the police → Rescue the casualties
보기2: ② Report to the police → Rescue the casualties → Secure the evidence at the scene
보기3: ③ Stop immediately → Rescue the casualties → Report to the police
보기4: ④ Stop immediately → Report to the police → Rescue the casualties

문제: 261. Which of the following is the most appropriate response in the event of an accident?
보기1: ① It is okay to leave the injured if the accident is minor.
보기2: ② Stop the vehicle and argue with the other driver in a busy intersection.
보기3: ③ Stop immediately and provide first aid when there are injured parties.
보기4: ④ If your car is damaged, leave the vehicle on the road without doing anything.

문제: 262. Which of the following injured persons should you move to a safe place first before providing first aid in the event of a traffic accident?
보기1: ① A person with a broken leg
보기2: ② Patient in a vehicle that can potentially catch fire due to the traffic accident
보기3: ③ An unconscious person hit by a vehicle while crossing the road.
보기4: ④ An injured person who asks to be left alone due to pain

문제: 263. When you are involved in a traffic accident, what should you check first to determine the physical condition of the injured?
보기1: ① Check the pulse of the injured.
보기2: ② Talk to the injured, or lightly shake their shoulders.
보기3: ③ Find the location of any wound that is bleeding heavily.
보기4: ④ Look into the mouth of the injured to check if anything is blocking his/her airway.

문제: 264. Which of the following is the correct method to perform first aid on the victim of a traffic accident with a serious neck injury?
보기1: ① Provide aid immediately.
보기2: ② Move the victim to the roadside to examine the injury.
보기3: ③ Move the car to the far-left lane to prevent any more accidents from occurring.
보기4: ④ Do not move the victim, and call 119 (emergency number) immediately.

문제: 265. A careless two-wheeled vehicle driver ran into a pedestrian, and the pedestrian collapsed. What is the first thing the driver should do?
보기1: ① Tap the pedestrian on the shoulder and ask him/her questions in a loud voice to see if the pedestrian is conscious.
보기2: ② Perform CPR on the pedestrian immediately.
보기3: ③ Secure the pedestrian’s airway to enable the pedestrian to breathe freely.
보기4: ④ Put pressure on the bleeding area on the pedestrian's leg.

문제: 266. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle was driving on the sidewalk and injured a pedestrian. Which of the following statements applies to the driver?
보기1: ① If the driver comes to a settlement with the victim, he/she will not be criminally charged or punished.
보기2: ② Even if the driver has comprehensive insurance, he/she will still be criminally charged and punished.
보기3: ③ If the driver has comprehensive insurance, he/she will not be criminally charged or punished.
보기4: ④ If the driver has liability insurance and driver’s insurance, he/she will not be criminally charged or punished.

문제: 267. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle violates the speed limit in a school zone and injures a child. What penalty will be imposed on the driver?
보기1: ① The driver will be criminally charged and punished only if the victim/family wishes to press charges.
보기2: ② The driver will be criminally charged and punished, regardless of the victim/family’s wishes.
보기3: ③ The driver will not be criminally charged or punished if he/she has comprehensive insurance.
보기4: ④ The driver will not be criminally charged or punished if he/she comes to a settlement with the victim/family.

문제: 268. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is on a road that is partly submerged due to heavy rain. What is the best method to drive?
보기1: ① Tightly hold onto the controls, accelerate, and drive through the section quickly.
보기2: ② Tightly hold onto the controls, and drive through the section slowly.
보기3: ③ If possible, take a detour.
보기4: ④ Enter the submerged section. If the engine shuts down, start the engine again and drive out of the submerged section of the road.

문제: 269. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle driving in an alleyway runs into a child walking in the alleyway. What is the correct response by the driver?
보기1: ① The impact on the child seems minor. Drive on without taking any action.
보기2: ② Ask the child if he/she is all right. Drive on if the child says he/she is fine.
보기3: ③ The child is at fault. Drive on.
보기4: ④ Contact the child’s parents, and report the incident to 112.

문제: 270. In which of the following cases is a driver's license suspended? (Currently, the driver has no demerit points)
보기1: ① Receiving 40 demerit points for causing a traffic accident
보기2: ② Receiving 30 demerit points for a traffic infringement
보기3: ③ Receiving 20 demerit points for a traffic infringement
보기4: ④ Causing an accident resulting in casualty due to drunk driving

문제: 271. In which of the following situations are you NOT allowed use your mobile phone while driving?
보기1: ① You need to report a natural disaster or other urgent matter.
보기2: ② Your vehicle is at a stop.
보기3: ③ Using a hand-held device while driving your vehicle.
보기4: ④ You are driving an emergency vehicle.

문제: 272. Which of the following will lead to cancellation of a Class II driver's license for small motor vehicles?
보기1: ① Failure to take an aptitude test within 6 months from the day after the date of expiration of regular aptitude test
보기2: ② Operation of a two-wheeled vehicle during a period of administrative punishment on one's driver's license
보기3: ③ When arrested for criminal charges related to violent driving
보기4: ④ When arrested for criminal charges related to dangerous group behaviors

문제: 273. Which of the following describes the accumulated penalty points that lead to the revocation of a driver’s license?
보기1: ① 100 points or more in 1 year
보기2: ② 191 points or more in 2 years
보기3: ③ 271 points or more in 3 years
보기4: ④ 301 points or more in 5 years

문제: 274. Which of the following statements about the actions to take when an accident occurs is correct?
보기1: ① You can report the accident to the police only if both sides reach an agreement.
보기2: ② Reporting the accident to an insurance company is just as effective as reporting it to the police.
보기3: ③ Immediately move your vehicle out from the site of the accident.
보기4: ④ For a minor accident, simply write down the damage and exchange contact information with the other party.

문제: 275. Which of the following explanations about the penalty imposed on those who interfere with the reporting of a traffic accident is correct?
보기1: ① Witnesses will not be subject to penalty.
보기2: ② The victim will not be subject to penalty.
보기3: ③ Anyone who interferes with the reporting of a traffic accident will be subject to penalty.
보기4: ④ There is no such penalty.

문제: 276. Which of the following is the correct situation where the driver of a motorcycle (excluding personal mobility devices) is not allowed to pass?
보기1: ① When passing through the second lane of a general road with 3 lanes in each direction.
보기2: ② When passing through the second lane of a general road with 2 lanes in each direction.
보기3: ③ When passing through a single left-turn lane.
보기4: ④ When passing along the roadside area.

문제: 277. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct penalty imposed on the driver of a personal transport device whose passenger(s) do not wear life protection equipment?
보기1: ① A fine of up to KRW 100,000
보기2: ② A fine of up to KRW 200,000
보기3: ③ A fine of up to KRW 300,000
보기4: ④ A fine of up to KRW 400,000

문제: 278. Under the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not considered to be a correct measure by police officers to prevent the risk of accident of a personal mobility device?
보기1: ① When the driver's blood-alcohol concentration is 0.03% or higher, ban on driving can be ordered.
보기2: ② When the driver's blood-alcohol concentration is 0.03% or higher, the personal transport device can be confiscated.
보기3: ③ If it is recognized that the driver is driving under the influence of alcohol, a police officer may request the driver to present his/her driver’s license.
보기4: ④ If it is recognized that the driver is driving without a license, a police officer may request the driver to present his/her driver’s license.

문제: 279. How many demerit points are given to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle for driving in a bicycle-only lane?
보기1: ① None
보기2: ② 10 points
보기3: ③ 15 points
보기4: ④ 30 points

문제: 280. Which of the following is categorized as a Class II driver’s license?
보기1: ① License to operate a large tow vehicle
보기2: ② License to operate a small tow vehicle
보기3: ③ License to operate a rescue vehicle
보기4: ④ License to operate a motorcycle

문제: 281. Which one of the following descriptions of the demerit points given to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who has caused an accident is incorrect?
보기1: ① For an accident where injuries require less than 5 days of medical treatment as per a doctor’s examination
보기2: ② For an accident where injuries require 5 days – 3 weeks of medical treatment as per a doctor’s examination
보기3: ③ For an accident where injuries require 3 or more weeks of medical treatment as per a doctor’s examination
보기4: ④ For an accident leading to the victim’s death within 72 hours of the accident

문제: 282. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the correct pair of fines and demerit points imposed on the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who operates a navigational system while driving?
보기1: ① KRW 20,000 fine – 10 demerit points
보기2: ② KRW 20,000 fine – 15 demerit points
보기3: ③ KRW 40,000 fine – 10 demerit points
보기4: ④ KRW 40,000 fine – 15 demerit points

문제: 283. According to the Road Traffic Act, how many demerit points are given to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who violates traffic lights, if his/her violation results in minor injuries to two people and serious injuries to two other people?
보기1: ① 35 points
보기2: ② 50 points
보기3: ③ 55 points
보기4: ④ 70 points

문제: 284. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT an administrative action taken against the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who causes an accident while driving?
보기1: ① No demerit points are given for injuries caused to self.
보기2: ② Demerit points are given for injuries sustained by a passenger.
보기3: ③ No penalty points are applied if the passenger is a family member/relative.
보기4: ④ Demerit points are halved if the accident involves a pedestrian and it is proved that the pedestrian is at greater fault.

문제: 285. According to the Road Traffic Act, in which of the following situations will a two-wheeled vehicle driver’s license NOT be canceled?
보기1: ① Imprisonment for dangerous collective conduct
보기2: ② Imprisonment for acts of road rage
보기3: ③ Imprisonment for aggressive driving
보기4: ④ Damaging a parked car and fleeing the scene

문제: 286. While driving a two-wheeled vehicle, person A scratched a car that was stopped/parked without its driver. However, A fled the scene without leaving his/her contact details. What is the correct administrative action taken against A?
보기1: ① Cancellation of the driver’s license
보기2: ② 15 demerit points for failing to leave personal details
보기3: ③ No demerit points are given for causing the accident
보기4: ④ Demerit points are still given even if the accident did not occur on the road.

문제: 287. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following offenses is subject to the highest demerit points?
보기1: ① Violation of traffic signal
보기2: ② Crossing the center line
보기3: ③ Failing to drive in the assigned lane
보기4: ④ Using the bus-only lane on a general roadway

문제: 288. Which of the following is incorrect regarding the period during which a driver is prohibited from acquiring a driver's license according to the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Driving without a valid driver's license three times or more
보기2: ② Causing at least 2 traffic accidents while driving with more than 0.03 percent of blood-alcohol concentration
보기3: ③ Injuring a person while driving and fleeing, without a valid driver's license
보기4: ④ Injuring a person while driving and fleeing, with more than 0.03 percent of blood-alcohol concentration

문제: 289. In which of the following situations is a two-wheeled vehicle driver NOT held liable for violation of traffic lights?
보기1: ① The driver drives on without stopping even when the traffic light turns to yellow before entering the intersection.
보기2: ② The driver starts slowly from the stop line with the intent to go straight when the traffic light is red.
보기3: ③ The driver turns right at red light even though this causes interference with the traffic.
보기4: ④ The driver turns left at green light because this does not cause interference with the traffic.

문제: 290. According to the Road Traffic Act, at which of the following points are vehicles prohibited from stopping/parking?
보기1: ① 7 meters in all directions from a safe zone
보기2: ② 7 meters from the edge of an intersection
보기3: ③ 7 meters from the corner of the road
보기4: ④ 7 meters from a point where emergency fire extinguishing equipment is installed

문제: 291. Which of the following is correct regarding how to drive two-wheeled vehicles (excluding emergency vehicles)?
보기1: ① Drivers of two-wheeled vehicles may drive on a motor vehicle-only lane.
보기2: ② If a lane is sufficiently wide, two two-wheeled vehicles may drive side by side.
보기3: ③ Two-wheeled vehicles may drive in Lanes 2 and 3 on a general road with three lanes in each direction.
보기4: ④ If two-wheeled vehicles are driving as a group, they should form a queue to prevent other vehicles from cuttingin.

문제: 292. Which of the following is an administrative disposition of a driver's license if the driver of a motorcycle is arrested for retaliation?
보기1: ① 40 days of license suspension
보기2: ② 60 days of license suspension
보기3: ③ 100 days of license suspension
보기4: ④ Revocation of license

문제: 293. Which of the following describes a case in which the driver is prohibited from acquiring a driver's license for a certain period of time due to criminal charges of driving a motorcycle without a valid license?
보기1: ① When a fine penalty has been confirmed
보기2: ② When the offender has received a suspended indictment
보기3: ③ When the offender has received a suspended sentence
보기4: ④ When the offender has received protective disposition according to Article 32 of the Juvenile Act

문제: 294. Which of the following correctly describes a violation of the Road Traffic Act on the part of a two-wheeled vehicle driver, which is punishable by cancellation of her/his driver's license?
보기1: ① Operation of a two-wheeled motor vehicle with 0.07 percent of blood-alcohol concentration for the first time
보기2: ② Acquisition of a driver's license during a period in which the person is disqualified from acquiring a driver's license
보기3: ③ When arrested for criminal charges related to violent driving
보기4: ④ When the driver causes a traffic accident leading to material damages, and flees the scene of accident

문제: 295. Which of the following statements regarding the deduction of demerit points (Good Driving Mileage) for taking the No-offense/No-accident Pledge is correct?
보기1: ① The driver must take the No-offense/No-accident Pledge and comply with it for 2 years.
보기2: ② 10 reward points are given.
보기3: ③ If the license is about to be canceled due to the accumulation of demerit points, reward points are deducted from the cumulative points.
보기4: ④ If reward points are not used, they expire after 5 years.

문제: 296. What happens to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who is caught driving with a blood alcohol concentration of 0.11 off the road for the first time?
보기1: ① His/her driver’s license is canceled.
보기2: ② His/her driver’s license is suspended.
보기3: ③ He/she is not criminally punished.
보기4: ④ He/she is criminally punished.

문제: 297. Which of the following offenses by a driver of a motorcycle (excluding personal mobility devices) is subject to criminal punishment, even if it is not committed on a public road?
보기1: ① Driving without a license.
보기2: ② Driving under the influence of drugs
보기3: ③ Dangerous collective conduct
보기4: ④ Violent driving

문제: 298. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle was criminally booked for drunk driving, and his or her driver’s license was canceled. In which of the following situations can the motorcyclist apply for cancellation of the administrative action concerning the driver’s license?
보기1: ① When under suspension of indictment
보기2: ② When under suspension of sentence
보기3: ③ When confirmed not guilty
보기4: ④ When under monetary penalty

문제: 299. Which of the following statements about submitting an objection to an administrative action concerning a driver’s license is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① The objection should be submitted within 60 days of receiving the administrative action.
보기2: ② The objection should be submitted to the commissioner of City/Do police agency in the jurisdiction.
보기3: ③ When the objection to the license cancellation is accepted, the action is converted to 100 demerit points.
보기4: ④ You may request an administrative trial independent of the objection.

문제: 300. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following offenses by the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle does NOT result in 40 demerit points?
보기1: ① When criminally charged for aggressive driving
보기2: ② When criminally charged for dangerous collective behavior
보기3: ③ When violating a speed limit (over 40 km/h and up to 60 km/h)
보기4: ④ When not subjected to summary trial 60 days after the due date for payment of penalty

문제: 301. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not the correct punishment on the violation of laws by a driver of two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① A KRW 20,000 penalty when not wearing personal protective gears such as helmet.
보기2: ② Up to 1 year of imprisonment or a fine of up to KRW 5 million in case of violent driving.
보기3: ③ A KRW 40,000 penalty when violating passage regulations such as passage on sidewalks.
보기4: ④ A KRW 20,000 penalty when using a mobile phone while driving.

문제: 302. The following are statements about speed limit violations caught on hidden cameras. Which of the following is correct?
보기1: ① Regardless of the type of vehicle or speed, the same fine or penalty will be imposed.
보기2: ② In addition to a fine, demerit points will be imposed.
보기3: ③ An additional penalty will be imposed if the violator is identified.
보기4: ④ If you do not pay the fine by the due date, additional charges of up to 75% may be levied.

문제: 303. The violation of which of the following speed limits (except for school zones) is subject to a special exception under the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents?
보기1: ① Exceeding 20 km/h
보기2: ② Exceeding 15 km/h
보기3: ③ Exceeding 10 km/h
보기4: ④ Exceeding 5 km/h

문제: 304. Which of the following traffic accidents is subject to the offense of dangerous driving resulting in injury or death under the Act on the Aggravated Punishment of Specific Crimes?
보기1: ① When a driver of a motorcycle injures a person while under the influence of drugs
보기2: ② When a cyclist under the influence of alcohol injures a person
보기3: ③ When the driver of an electric bicycle under the influence of alcohol injures a person
보기4: ④ When the driver of an electric bicycle under the influence of drugs injures a person

문제: 305. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT a correct prohibition related to personal mobility device?
보기1: ① Prohibition of use for children under the age of 13
보기2: ② Prohibition on passing through sidewalks and crosswalks
보기3: ③ Prohibition on driving at night
보기4: ④ Prohibition on driving under the influence of alcohol

문제: 306. When the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle creates noises that cause damage to others without a reasonable cause, which of the following describes a situation that is not punishable by the law?
보기1: ① Causing noise by abruptly starting the engine or by increasing the speed
보기2: ② Revving up the motor without delivering electric power to the wheel
보기3: ③ Sounding the horn repetitively or continuously
보기4: ④ Sounding the horn at a child who is jaywalking

문제: 307. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is considered a dangerous behavior?
보기1: ① Reckless driving by two high school students on a two-wheeled vehicle
보기2: ② Speeding by an automobile
보기3: ③ Three cars and a two-wheeled vehicle obstructing traffic
보기4: ④ Dozens of two-wheeled vehicles parked in a parking lot

문제: 308. A vehicle fails to stop temporarily in front of a railroad crossing and collides with a train, causing an accident involving human injury. In this case, which of the following statements about the punishments that will be imposed on the driver is correct?
보기1: ① The driver will not receive criminal punishment if he/she has comprehensive automobile insurance or reaches an agreement with the victim regarding compensation.
보기2: ② According to the Road Traffic Act, the driver will only receive an administrative punishment for violating the prescribed method of passing a railroad crossing.
보기3: ③ The driver will be subject to criminal punishment for causing an accident involving human injury through violating the prescribed method of passing a railroad crossing.
보기4: ④ The Road Traffic Act and the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents do not apply to accidents occurring at a railroad crossing.

문제: 309. Which of the following is a traffic accident caused by speed violation that can be prosecuted against the stated intention of the victim under the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents? (Excluding school zones)
보기1: ① In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 5km/h
보기2: ② In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 10km/h
보기3: ③ In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 15km/h
보기4: ④ In case of an accident resulting in personal injury caused by exceeding the speed limit of the relevant road by 20km/h

문제: 310. Which of the following is subject to the “Prohibition of Reckless Driving” under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① Personal mobility device
보기2: ② A two-wheeled vehicle
보기3: ③ Electronic bicycle
보기4: ④ Bicycle

문제: 311. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is NOT correct for vehicles, etc. (excluding personal mobility devices) regarding speed limit?
보기1: ① The maximum speed of motor vehicle-only lane is 90 km/h.
보기2: ② The maximum speed in an expressway with one lane in each direction is 80 km/h.
보기3: ③ The speed in the general road of residential areas, commercial areas and industrial areas is within 70 km/h.
보기4: ④ The speed of school zones is within 30 km/h.

문제: 312. Which of the following is the penalty that you would incur for hitting an elementary student crossing a crosswalk without pedestrian signals, causing a minor injury?
보기1: ① You will be subject to criminal prosecution according to the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents.
보기2: ② You will not be subject to criminal prosecution if you have comprehensive insurance.
보기3: ③ Since the victim is a minor, you just need to contact his/her parents.
보기4: ④ There's no need for you to give your contact details to the victim.

문제: 313. Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the traffic standards by lane under the Road Traffic Act?
보기1: ① The type of lane to be used by cars is determined by dividing the road into an expressway, a automobile road, and other roads that have two or more lanes.
보기2: ② On roads other than expressways, two-wheeled vehicles must travel in the right lane.
보기3: ③ On the expressway, trucks must travel in the right lane.
보기4: ④ Motorcycles must travel in the right lane to turn left at an intersection with two left-turn lanes.

문제: 314. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not considered an automobile?
보기1: ① A truck
보기2: ② A special-purpose vehicle
보기3: ③ A two-wheeled vehicle
보기4: ④ A motorcycle

문제: 315. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is the correct amount of penalty imposed on a person who refused to take breathalyzer test after being caught riding a bicycle under the influence of alcohol by a police officer?
보기2: ② KRW 50,000
보기3: ③ KRW 30,000
보기4: ④ There is no penalty.

문제: 316. According to the Road Traffic Act, which one of the following is NOT authorized to give signals or instructions to drivers?
보기1: ① Auxiliary Police Officer
보기2: ② Persons designated as Best Drivers
보기3: ③ Crossing guards
보기4: ④ Firefighters guiding firefighting vehicles responding to an emergency

문제: 317. Which of the following is NOT a correct way to use an intersection when the traffic light is yellow?
보기1: ① Stop before the stop line.
보기2: ② If you are already in the intersection, drive quickly out of the intersection.
보기3: ③ You may turn right as long as you are not interfering with the traffic.
보기4: ④ It is a violation of the rules to pass through the intersection even if you proceed after you are already in the intersection.

문제: 318. In which of the following situations should a two-wheeled vehicle NOT drive along the center or left side of the road?
보기1: ① On a one-way road
보기2: ② When right turns are not allowed due to road works
보기3: ③ When traffic is congested
보기4: ④ When you drive based on the hand signals given by a police officer

문제: 319. Which of the following is NOT a correct way to drive a two-wheeled vehicle in a place where there is a clear distinction between the roadway and sidewalk?
보기1: ① Drive your two-wheeled vehicle on the roadway.
보기2: ② You can cross the sidewalk on your two-wheeled vehicle to enter or exit areas outside the road.
보기3: ③ You can drive your two-wheeled vehicle on the sidewalk to deliver mail.
보기4: ④ Even a senior citizen driving a two-wheeled vehicle is not allowed to drive on the sidewalk.

문제: 320. Which of the following statements about driving in the bus-only lane of a general roadway is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① A 36-seater or larger passenger vehicle may use the bus-only lane.
보기2: ② All vehicles may use the bus-only lane if all lanes other than the bus-only lane are damaged.
보기3: ③ A 25-seater passenger vehicle carrying domestic tourists may use the bus-only lane.
보기4: ④ A taxi may use the bus-only lane briefly if the customers want to get out of the taxi.

문제: 321. According to the Road Traffic Act, the term 'dangerous collective conduct' describes an action by ( ) or more people driving two or more vehicles (excluding personal mobility devices) together on the road and causing risk to others without any legitimate reason. Which of the following fits in ( )?
보기1: ① 1
보기2: ② 2
보기3: ③ 3
보기4: ④ 4

문제: 322. Which of the following statements is NOT correct regarding a lane change by two-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① Change lanes safely at a section marked by dotted white lines.
보기2: ② You may change lanes over solid white lines as long as you are not interfering with the traffic.
보기3: ③ Use a turn signal to show the direction in which you wish to change lanes.
보기4: ④ Turn signals must be activated even if there are no vehicles or pedestrians nearby.

문제: 323. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT a situation in which you should slow down to 50% of the speed limit?
보기1: ① The road is wet due to rain.
보기2: ② The road is icy.
보기3: ③ Your visibility is limited to 100 meters due to fog, etc.
보기4: ④ The road is covered with 20 millimeters or more of snow.

문제: 324. Which one of the following ways of overtaking another vehicle is correct?
보기1: ① Overtake by going to the left side of the vehicle ahead.
보기2: ② To prevent risk, overtake when the vehicle ahead is at a stop.
보기3: ③ Overtake on a bridge.
보기4: ④ Overtake when a vehicle to the left of the vehicle ahead of you is moving side by side with it.

문제: 325. Which of the following is the correct way of yielding at an intersection without traffic control?
보기1: ① If there are vehicles attempting to enter the intersection at the same time, the vehicle to the right must give way to the vehicle on the left.
보기2: ② A vehicle that enters the intersection after other vehicles must give way to the vehicles that have already entered the intersection.
보기3: ③ A vehicle that wants to turn right must give way to the vehicle trying to take a left turn.
보기4: ④ A vehicle entering from a wider road must give way to the vehicle entering from a narrow road.

문제: 326. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following lights should be turned on if a driver of a Motorcycle is driving on foggy road?
보기1: ① Side light and number plate light
보기2: ② Side light and tail light
보기3: ③ Head light and tail light
보기4: ④ Number plate light and head light

문제: 327. Which of the following statements about the lights of two-wheeled vehicles is NOT correct?
보기1: ① When there is oncoming traffic, lower the headlights.
보기2: ② When following a vehicle ahead, lower your headlights.
보기3: ③ If a vehicle ahead does not give way to you, alternate the headlights between the low- and high-beams.
보기4: ④ Keep the headlights lowered in areas with busy traffic other than the areas designated by the commissioner of City/Do police agency

문제: 328. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT correct regarding regulations that prohibit dangerous group behaviors? (excluding personal mobility devices)
보기1: ① The regulations are only for automobiles and motorcycles.
보기2: ② The regulations refer to a dangerous behavior in a group setting, queuing and driving in a line, and creating traffic hazards.
보기3: ③ The regulations also apply to vehicles participating in a national event pursuant to the law.
보기4: ④ The person who plans and/or leads a dangerous behavior in a group setting is also subject to penalties.

문제: 329. Which of the following statements is correct regarding regulations that prohibit driving when fatigued (including drowsy driving)?
보기1: ① Driving in a sick or ill condition is not included in the regulations.
보기2: ② Fatigued drivers will be imposed a fine (noticed disposition) for failing to drive in a safe manner.
보기3: ③ Fatigued drivers will be criminally charged and may be subject to imprisonment or a fine up to KRW 300,000.
보기4: ④ The driver will receive 30 demerit points.

문제: 330. A police officer is allowed to remove an illegal fitting from a two-wheeled vehicle for safety. Which one of the following is NOT allowed to be removed?
보기1: ① Any device that impedes the functioning of equipment used for traffic control or speed detection
보기2: ② Wide tires that fail to meet the standards
보기3: ③ A radio communication device with the same frequency as the police radio
보기4: ④ Flashing lights, siren, or emergency lights fitted to non-emergency vehicles

문제: 331. Which of the following situations does NOT result in criminal penalties with regards to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle with comprehensive insurance under the Act on Special Cases Concerning the Settlement of Traffic Accidents?
보기1: ① The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle crosses the center line and crashes into an oncoming car, resulting in an injury requiring 2 weeks of medical treatment.
보기2: ② The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle travels 25 km/h faster than the prescribed limit and crashes into a vehicle ahead, resulting in an injury requiring 2 weeks of medical treatment.
보기3: ③ The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle hits a senior citizen walking in an alleyway, resulting in an injury requiring 3weeks of medical treatment.
보기4: ④ The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle hits a pedestrian on a crosswalk (no traffic lights for pedestrians), resulting in an injury requiring 3 weeks of medical treatment.

문제: 332. Which one of the following is NOT the correct method for the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle to respond to a traffic accident?
보기1: ① Helping the injured
보기2: ② Ensuring that the traffic is not affected
보기3: ③ Continuing to drive after asking the passenger to take necessary measures or report the situation to the authorities, even if you are not in an emergency situation
보기4: ④ Even if you only damaged a stopped/parked vehicle, you still need to provide your personal details to the victim.

문제: 333. Which of the following is an administrative disposition regarding a driver's license if the driver of a motorcycle is criminally charged for dangerous group behavior?
보기1: ① 40 days of license suspension
보기2: ② 60 days of license suspension
보기3: ③ 100 days of license suspension
보기4: ④ Revocation of license

문제: 334. What happens when the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle abruptly stops in front of a passenger car due to road rage?
보기1: ① The driver will receive a fine for failing to comply with the regulations prohibiting abrupt stops.
보기2: ② Pursuant to the Criminal Code, a charge of special threat will be applied, and the driver will be criminally booked.
보기3: ③ If criminally booked, the driver will receive 40 demerit points.
보기4: ④ If jailed, the driver will receive 100 demerit points.

문제: 335. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT correct regarding the regulations against aggressive driving? (excluding personal mobility devices)
보기1: ① The regulations apply only to automobile drivers and motorcyclists.
보기2: ② The regulations apply when two or more legal offenses (or a single legal offense) are continued and repeated.
보기3: ③ The regulations apply when a driver/passenger is threatened or harmed, or a traffic-related risk is present.
보기4: ④ An offender can be sentenced with up to a year in prison or a fine of up to KRW 5 million.

문제: 336. Which of the following statements about the requirements related to drivers of two-wheeled vehicles wearing a safety helmet is NOT correct?
보기1: ① A two-wheeled vehicle driver who does not wear a safety helmet will be imposed a fine of KRW 20,000.
보기2: ② The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle carrying a passenger without a safety helmet will be imposed a fine of KRW 20,000.
보기3: ③ In principle, a two-wheeled vehicle driver wearing a safety helmet that does not meet the prescribed safety standards can be pulled over by police.
보기4: ④ The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle pushing their vehicle without wearing a safety helmet can be pulled over by police.

문제: 337. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is NOT correct regarding the regulations that prohibit drunk driving?
보기1: ① The regulations apply to automobiles, motorcycles, and all construction machinery vehicles.
보기2: ② Drunk driving that is not on a public road is still against the regulations.
보기3: ③ Driving a short distance to park one’s vehicle while under the influence of alcohol is still against the regulations.
보기4: ④ A driver who has consumed alcoholic beverages will be criminally punished if his or her blood alcohol concentration is 0.02% or higher.

문제: 338. According to the Toll Road Act, which of the following is NOT a reason for imposing 10 times higher than the discounted toll fee?
보기1: ① When receiving discount by forging or altering a pass.
보기2: ② If a driver exchanges his/her pass with a different person's pass for a discount.
보기3: ③ When receiving a discount by showing the certificate subject to toll fee exemption held by other person.
보기4: ④ When passing through a Hi-pass lane without a Hi-pass device.

문제: 339. Which of the following is not a correct description of the U-turn method?
보기1: ① If you make a U-turn while interfering with other vehicles in progress at the U-turn point, it is a violation of rules governing the U-turn.
보기2: ② If there is no auxiliary sign and only a U-turn sign is present, you can make a U-turn regardless of the signal as long as you do not interfere with other traffic.
보기3: ③ If you make a U-turn on a road with a centerline without a U-turn sign, it is a violation of rules governing the U-turn.
보기4: ④ If you make a U-turn by ignoring the U-turn prohibition sign, it is a violation of instructions.

문제: 340. Which of the following statements regarding two-wheeled motor vehicles using a pedestrian sidewalk is NOT correct?
보기1: ① Drive your two-wheeled vehicle on the road in cases where the road and sidewalk are separately marked.
보기2: ② You can cross the sidewalk on your two-wheeled vehicle when you are going outside of the road.
보기3: ③ You must not interfere with pedestrian traffic when you need to cross the sidewalk on your two-wheeled vehicle.
보기4: ④ If the driver of the two-wheeled vehicle is a senior citizen or a mobility disadvantaged person, he or she can use the motorcycle on the sidewalk.

문제: 341. Which of the following statements regarding drivers of two-wheeled vehicles using an intersection is NOT correct?
보기1: ① To turn right on your two-wheeled vehicle, slow down and drive along the edge on the right side of the road.
보기2: ② To turn left on your two-wheeled vehicle, turn along the inner side on the intersection's center.
보기3: ③ Do not enter the intersection if you see traffic congestion and think your entry could interfere with the traffic.
보기4: ④ If your entry is not likely to interfere with the traffic, you may overtake toward the right side of the intersection and continue forward.

문제: 342. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is considered a ‘motor vehicle’?

보기3: ③ Baby stroller, wheelchairs to aid walking, electronic two-wheeled balance car

문제: 343. According to the Promotion of the Use of Bicycles Act, which of the following is not a bicycle lane?
