보기2: ② Bicycle-only roadway
보기3: ③ Bicycle priority lane
보기4: ④ Bicycle priority roadway

문제: 344. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not a PMD?
보기1: ① Electric kick scooters
보기2: ② Self-balancing scooters
보기3: ③ Electric unicycles
보기4: ④ Electric bicycles powered by a motor

문제: 345. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle detects a cyclist traveling ahead on a curve. What is the safest method for the motorcyclist to drive?
보기1: ① Since bicycles are slow, you should increase your speed and overtake it quickly.
보기2: ② Use the horn to alert the bicycle, and then drive close to the median strip at a high speed.
보기3: ③ Keep a safe following distance and follow the bicycle until the curve is over.
보기4: ④ Use the space on the edge of the road to drive fast.

문제: 346. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle sees a person pushing a bicycle across the road. What is the safest method for the motorcyclist to drive?
보기1: ① Warn the person in a loud voice, and drive on at reduced speed.
보기2: ② Keep a safe following distance, and stop temporarily.
보기3: ③ Use the horn to prevent the person from crossing, and drive on.
보기4: ④ Slowly pass through the back of the person crossing.

문제: 347. A two-wheeled vehicle is about to turn right after a bicycle ahead. Which of the following is the safest method to drive?
보기1: ① The two-wheeled vehicle should turn right before the bicycle does.
보기2: ② Use the horn to stop the bicycle, and turn right on your two-wheeled vehicle.
보기3: ③ Turn right side by side with the bicycle.
보기4: ④ Slow down and let the bicycle take the right turn first.

문제: 348. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is considered a motor vehicle or horse? (Under the width of 1 m)
보기1: ① A rollator
보기2: ② A bicycle used by a senior person
보기3: ③ A handcart (not motorized)
보기4: ④ A walking frame

문제: 349. Which lane should bicycles use on a general road with three lanes in each direction??
보기1: ① First lane
보기2: ② Second Lane
보기3: ③ Third lane
보기4: ④ Any lane

문제: 350. Which of the following is not true about the criteria and operation of PMDs?
보기1: ① Vehicles with an engine displacement of 125 cc or below should be equipped with a motor that cuts out when the device reaches or above a speed of 25 kph.
보기2: ② Vehicles equipped with a maximum motor output of 11 kW or below and that weighs less than 35 kg.
보기3: ③ The penalty for driving a PMD without a driver's license is a fine of KRW 100,000.
보기4: ④ A driver who is evidently deemed by the police to be driving a PMD while intoxicated and who refuses a breathalyzer test will be fined KRW 130,000.

문제: 351. Which of the following is the correct pair of vehicles that can use a bicycle crossing?
보기1: ① Two-wheeled vehicle, bicycle
보기2: ② Motorcycle, wheelchairs to aid walking
보기3: ③ Wheelchairs to aid walking, bicycle
보기4: ④ Electric scooter, electric two-wheeled balance car

문제: 352. Which of the following is a good method to increase your two-wheeled vehicle’s fuel efficiency?
보기1: ① Avoid sudden acceleration and braking.
보기2: ② Keep the tire air pressure slightly lower than the required level.
보기3: ③ Always go at high speed to get to your destination.
보기4: ④ Fully load your vehicle with cargo.

문제: 353. Which of the following is NOT an environmentally-friendly or economic driving practice?
보기1: ① Minimal idling
보기2: ② Maintaining an economic speed
보기3: ③ Departing swiftly without delay
보기4: ④ Utilizing inertia when driving

문제: 354. Which of the following is a good approach to eco-friendly and fuel-efficient driving?
보기1: ① Drive at a moderate speed.
보기2: ② Accelerate and turn abruptly.
보기3: ③ A two-wheeled vehicle needs to be inspected only when parts are being replaced.
보기4: ④ Use inertia to your advantage on an uphill drive, and coast down hills.

문제: 355. Which of the following is a good approach to eco-friendly and fuel-efficient driving?
보기1: ① Make it a habit to stay up to date with driving-related information.
보기2: ② Using adulterated petrol can reduce your fuel costs.
보기3: ③ Load your vehicle fully with cargo.
보기4: ④ Tires need to be inspected only ahead of long-distance drives and vacations.

문제: 356. Which of the following is NOT an environmentally conscious driver?
보기1: ① A driver who maintains the prescribed tire pressure
보기2: ② A driver who maintains a constant speed and does not accelerate abruptly
보기3: ③ A driver who does not start or apply brakes abruptly
보기4: ④ A driver who keeps the air-conditioner on at all times

문제: 357. What is the term used for the speed at which fuel savings are the greatest?
보기1: ① Minimum speed
보기2: ② Maximum speed
보기3: ③ Economy speed
보기4: ④ Statutory speed

문제: 358. What is the best method to increase the fuel efficiency of an automobile?
보기1: ① Lower the tire pressure.
보기2: ② Fill up the fuel tank as often as you can.
보기3: ③ Use the lower gears when you drive.
보기4: ④ Remove any unnecessary loads from the trunk.

문제: 359. Which of the following drivers is the best at enhancing fuel efficiency?
보기1: ① A driver who always starts abruptly
보기2: ② A driver who maintains a constant speed
보기3: ③ A driver who always stops abruptly
보기4: ④ A driver who uses lower gears

문제: 360. Which of the following is a good practice for fuel-efficient driving?
보기1: ① Always drive over the speed limit.
보기2: ② Switch off the ignition while going downhill.
보기3: ③ Reduce the air pressure in your tires.
보기4: ④ Avoid sudden acceleration and braking.

문제: 361. Which of the following is a good practice for eco-friendly driving?
보기1: ① Don’t worry about checking the air pressure in your tires regularly.
보기2: ② Develop a habit of driving at a constant speed, and avoid excessive braking.
보기3: ③ When refueling, fill up the tank to make sure you don't run out of fuel.
보기4: ④ Make a habit of idling to protect the engine.

문제: 362. Which of the following is the most environmentally friendly driving practice?
보기1: ① Drive at a steady speed even when there is no traffic congestion
보기2: ② Spend 5 minutes idling before departing and after arriving at your destination in order to extend the life of your car
보기3: ③ Reduce the tire pressure by 5% in order to increase traction
보기4: ④ Keep about 10 kg of baggage in the car's trunk to improve driving stability

문제: 363. On a road without a separate sidewalk, why are cars required to park at least 50 centimeters from the right edge?
보기1: ① To allow bicycles to pass by
보기2: ② To allow two-wheeled vehicles to pass by
보기3: ③ To allow pedestrians to pass by
보기4: ④ To allow cars to pass by

문제: 364. When a situation occurs while you are driving, you should recognize the situation, ( ) how to act, and then operate the steering wheel and lighting system of the car. Which of the following fits in the parentheses?
보기1: ① Recognize
보기2: ② Judge
보기3: ③ Manipulate
보기4: ④ Operate

문제: 365. Which of the following best describes driving in a tunnel?
보기1: ① You are not allowed to change lanes in a tunnel.
보기2: ② It is strictly prohibited to overtake another vehicle in a tunnel.
보기3: ③ Transitional light adaptation often occurs when entering a tunnel.
보기4: ④ Transitional dark adaptation often occurs when leaving a tunnel.

문제: 366. A driver of a two-wheeled vehicle committed a traffic violation at 11 AM in a priority zone for persons with disabilities. Which of the following constitutes an aggravated punishment?
보기1: ① Entering a no-access zone or an access restricted area
보기2: ② Crossing the center line
보기3: ③ Mobile phone use while driving
보기4: ④ Improper changing of lanes

문제: 367. Children can be considered 'walking red lights.' With this in mind, which of the following is unlikely to be the behavioral characteristics of children?
보기1: ① Children tend to act whimsically.
보기2: ② Children tend to run straight across without looking left and right if their mothers call for them from across the road.
보기3: ③ When the lights turn green at a crosswalk children tend to run across, looking only ahead.
보기4: ④ Children tend to move very slowly and hesitantly.

문제: 368. Which of the following statements about two-wheeled vehicles is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Unlike drivers of four-wheeled vehicles, persons driving two-wheeled vehicles are exposed to the environment. A conscious effort must be made to keep the vehicle balanced.
보기2: ② Two-wheeled vehicles become less visible at nighttime.
보기3: ③ Two-wheeled vehicles on the road can always be seen by persons driving four-wheeled vehicles.
보기4: ④ Sudden braking around a bend can lead to sliding.

문제: 369. Which of the following statements about a two-wheeled vehicle with a passenger is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Keeping the vehicle balanced becomes more difficult with a passenger. There are greater chances of a traffic accident occurring.
보기2: ② A speed that is lower than the speed used when driving alone should be maintained, and sudden braking should be avoided.
보기3: ③ The two-wheeled vehicle is easier to balance if the rear passenger sits with both legs over one side.
보기4: ④ A passenger should not be taken on board when the road is slippery due to snow or rain.

문제: 370. Which of the following describes the correct method to overtake on a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① A two-wheeled vehicle can overtake a vehicle traveling ahead along its left.
보기2: ② In congested traffic, a two-wheeled vehicle can overtake by driving in between vehicles.
보기3: ③ A two-wheeled vehicle can overtake a vehicle traveling ahead even when another vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction.
보기4: ④ A two-wheeled vehicle can overtake other vehicles when traffic is congested by driving along the roadside area.

문제: 371. Which of the following statements about how to drive a two-wheeled vehicle safely is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Always stay alert, as two-wheeled vehicles are not as readily visible as cars.
보기2: ② Always stay alert to keep the two-wheeled vehicle balanced.
보기3: ③ Because they have only two wheels, it is easier to apply brake to two-wheeled vehicles compared to passenger cars.
보기4: ④ Always wear a safety helmet for protection.

문제: 372. Which of the following is a correct description of tires used in two-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① The cross section of the tire is round.
보기2: ② The tires do not have treads.
보기3: ③ The front and rear tires all have the same size and structure.
보기4: ④ The tires have shorter braking distances than the tires used for automobiles.

문제: 373. Which of the following describes how the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle can change direction safely?
보기1: ① While maintaining a certain distance from the vehicle behind you, change direction at the current speed.
보기2: ② While maintaining a certain distance from the vehicle behind you, change direction at an increased speed.
보기3: ③ If a vehicle approaches from the rear, slow down suddenly and then change direction.
보기4: ④ If a vehicle approaches from the rear, change direction suddenly.

문제: 374. Which of the following statements about the correct method to drive a two-wheeled vehicle is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Do not start or accelerate suddenly.
보기2: ② Do not rev up the engine without transferring the power to the wheels.
보기3: ③ At nighttime, you should avoid wearing a helmet in order to maintain a good field of vision.
보기4: ④ Do not cause a safety hazard by riding side by side with other two-wheeled vehicles.

문제: 375. Which of the following describes the safest method to brake a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① It is safe to brake only the front wheel.
보기2: ② It is safe to brake only the rear wheel.
보기3: ③ It is safe to brake the front and rear wheels at the same time.
보기4: ④ It is safe to brake the rear wheel first and then the front wheel.

문제: 376. Which of the following guidelines related to inspecting a two-wheeled vehicle before operation is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Do not drive a two-wheeled vehicle with a structure or equipment that does not meet the safety standards.
보기2: ② A two-wheeled vehicle should be allowed to idle for a long time for ride comfort and fuel efficiency.
보기3: ③ Check air pressure and wear of the tires before driving a two-wheeled vehicle.
보기4: ④ Adjust the mirrors so that it is possible to see vehicles approaching from the rear before driving a two-wheeled vehicle.

문제: 377. Which of the following is the correct method to change directions on a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① Two-wheeled vehicles can change direction on roads where change of direction is prohibited.
보기2: ② Because two-wheeled vehicles can drive only in the far-right lane, they cannot overtake a vehicle ahead on its left.
보기3: ③ A vehicle ahead can be overtaken on its right on a bend.
보기4: ④ Before changing directions on a two-wheeled vehicle, check the rear-view mirrors to make sure it is safe to do so.

문제: 378. Which of the following statements about the correct method for a two-wheeled vehicle to drive around a corner or bend is incorrect?
보기1: ① Slow down in advance of the turn, and take the turn at a reduced speed.
보기2: ② Jerking the handle or slamming on the brakes can cause the two-wheeled motor vehicle to fall over or slide.
보기3: ③ Take the turn at a high speed in case a vehicle coming from the opposite direction drives over the center line.
보기4: ④ Take care not to drive into the off-tracking path of another vehicle turning in the same direction at the same time.

문제: 379. Which of the following is the biggest hazard for a two-wheeled vehicle taking a right turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① A vehicle traveling straight from the opposite direction
보기2: ② A vehicle traveling straight on the right side of the road
보기3: ③ A vehicle turning left from the opposite direction
보기4: ④ A vehicle turning right from the opposite direction

문제: 380. Which of the following is the biggest safety hazard for a two-wheeled vehicle taking an unprotected left turn at an intersection?
보기1: ① A dump truck stopped on the other side of the road
보기2: ② A two-wheeled vehicle traveling straight from the opposite direction
보기3: ③ A bus waiting on the right-hand side of the road for a signal
보기4: ④ A passenger vehicle turning left from the opposite direction

문제: 381. Which of the following can affect the brake reaction distance of a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① Rain
보기2: ② Snow
보기3: ③ Defective brakes
보기4: ④ Driver fatigue

문제: 382. Which of the following must a person driving a two-wheeled vehicle on the road at nighttime illuminate?
보기1: ① Headlights and sidelights
보기2: ② Headlights and taillights
보기3: ③ Headlights and license plate lights
보기4: ④ Headlights and fog lights

문제: 383. The load conditions of a two-wheeled vehicle must not exceed the safety limits defined in the Road Traffic Act. Which of the following does NOT meet the standard?
보기1: ① Maximum height of 3 m from the ground
보기2: ② A length with 30 cm added to the seating device or loading device.
보기3: ③ A width of the range where the cargo can be checked if the cargo is loaded lower than the height of the rear-view mirror.
보기4: ④ A width of the range where the rear can be seen when the cargo is loaded higher than the height of the rear-view mirror.

문제: 384. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is the legal speed limit for two-wheeled vehicles on a general road with two lanes in each direction?
보기1: ① Within 60km/h
보기2: ② Within 70km/h
보기3: ③ Within 80km/h
보기4: ④ Within 90km/h

문제: 385. Which of the following is the appropriate action for the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle to take when a disabled person unable to use road-crossing facilities such as an underpass or overpass is crossing the road?
보기1: ① Drive through at a reduced speed.
보기2: ② Bring the vehicle to a stop.
보기3: ③ Quickly drive around the disabled person.
보기4: ④ Sound the horn to warn the disabled person and drive through.

문제: 386. Which of the following is the appropriate action for a two-wheeled vehicle driver upon spotting a pedestrian crossing a road without a crosswalk?
보기1: ① Maintain a safe distance and drive at a reduced speed.
보기2: ② Maintain a safe distance and bring the vehicle to a stop.
보기3: ③ Sound the horn and drive at a reduced speed.
보기4: ④ Slow down and drive at a reduced speed, steering behind the pedestrian.

문제: 387. Which of the following statements about the stopping distance of a two-wheeled vehicle is correct?
보기1: ① The stopping distance is reduced when the vehicle is loaded with cargo.
보기2: ② Free running distance is the distance required for a vehicle to come to a stop after its brakes are applied.
보기3: ③ Stopping distance is calculated by adding free running distance to braking distance.
보기4: ④ Braking distance is the distance traveled by a vehicle before its brakes start functioning after being applied by the driver.

문제: 388. The driver of a two-wheeled vehicle intends to overtake a vehicle ahead. Which of the following is the safest time to do so?
보기1: ① When there is an oncoming vehicle approaching from the opposite direction
보기2: ② When the vehicle ahead is moving left to make a left turn
보기3: ③ When the vehicle ahead is overtaking the vehicle in front of it
보기4: ④ When the vehicle ahead is keeping a sufficient driving distance from the vehicle in front of it

문제: 389. How much is the fine for a two-wheeled vehicle driver not covered with insurance? (First violation; excluding car accidents)
보기1: ① KRW 50,000
보기2: ② KRW 70,000

문제: 390. Which of the following recommendations for the safe driving of two-wheeled vehicles is correct?
보기1: ① Drive at a reduced speed when a pedestrian is crossing a crosswalk.
보기2: ② A Class I driver’s license for special motor vehicles is required to drive a two-wheeled vehicle with an engine displacement of 126 cc or higher.
보기3: ③ Maintain a safe distance and drive at a reduced speed when there is a pedestrian in a safety zone.
보기4: ④ For motorcycles exceeding 125 cc, only the driver needs to wear a safety helmet.

문제: 391. Which of the following statements about the correct method for the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle to drive through a foggy area is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Drive at a reduced speed with the headlights and emergency lights on. Avoid sudden acceleration and deceleration.
보기2: ② Maintain a safe distance by keeping an eye on the taillights of the vehicle ahead, your lane, and the guard-rail next to you.
보기3: ③ Exercise extra caution around tunnel entrances and riverside roads.
보기4: ④ Drive at 80% of the generally prescribed speed limit for the area if the visibility is less than 100 m.

문제: 392. Which of the following describes a safe driving practice for persons driving two-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① Drivers of two-wheeled vehicles should park inside safety zones.
보기2: ② Overtake a vehicle ahead using the right edge of the road.
보기3: ③ When the lights turn yellow while you are driving through an intersection, stop inside the intersection.
보기4: ④ Maintain a safe distance to avoid collisions in case a vehicle ahead applies brakes suddenly.

문제: 393. Which of the following holds true when a two-wheeled vehicle traveling at high speed in the rain brakes suddenly after the vehicle ahead stops?
보기1: ① Sudden braking increases tire traction, so the motorcycle doesn't slide.
보기2: ② Tire traction is reduced in rain, so the braking distance is increased.
보기3: ③ Tire traction is reduced in rain, so the sliding distance is shortened.
보기4: ④ It is easier to maneuver as tire traction increases in rain.

문제: 394. Which of the following describes the safest method to drive a two-wheeled vehicle on a gravelly or bumpy road?
보기1: ① Make wide turns.
보기2: ② Increase speed and drive in high gear.
보기3: ③ Just focus on maintaining balance.
보기4: ④ Stay in a lower gear and maintain a constant speed.

문제: 395. Which of the following is NOT correct regarding the safest method to drive a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① Right before crossing a sidewalk, drive at a reduced speed.
보기2: ② On a road where a footpath and vehicle road are separated, drive on the vehicle road.
보기3: ③ When entering or leaving places other than roads, a sidewalk may be used for passage.
보기4: ④ Drive through the right from the center of the road.

문제: 396. Which of the following is the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle not prohibited from doing?
보기1: ① Drinking and driving
보기2: ② Unlicensed driving
보기3: ③ Driving while fatigued
보기4: ④ Driving with the headlights on

문제: 397. Which of the following is NOT suitable for a safety helmet to be worn when driving a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① A safety helmet with a reflective band on its rear
보기2: ② A safety helmet that has shock absorption and penetration resistance
보기3: ③ A safety helmet that does not significantly impede hearing
보기4: ④ A safety helmet that weighs more than 2kg

문제: 398. Which of the following describes the safest method to drive a two-wheeled vehicle on a road with a visibility of 100 m or less?
보기1: ① Drive at 80% of the speed limit.
보기2: ② Keep as close to the vehicle ahead as possible, as the road ahead is not clearly visible.
보기3: ③ Use high-beam headlights to see the road ahead.
보기4: ④ Turn on the headlights or fog lights. If required, turn on the emergency lights.

문제: 399. Which of the following speed limits will not be enforced on the drivers of two-wheeled vehicles driving on a general road?
보기1: ① Legal speed limit
보기2: ② Speed limit
보기3: ③ Maximum speed
보기4: ④ Minimum speed

문제: 400. Which of the following is the penalty imposed on the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle (excluding emergency two-wheeled vehicles) caught driving on an expressway or a motor vehicle-only lane?
보기1: ① A fine of KRW 60,000
보기2: ② A fine of KRW 100,000
보기3: ③ A fine of up to KRW 300,000 and/or detention
보기4: ④ None

문제: 401. According to the Road Traffic Act, which of the following is not true about operating a PMD?
보기1: ① Turn on headlights and daytime running lights when driving at night.
보기2: ② The person riding together with the driver must also wear protective gear.
보기3: ③ An electric kick scooter is designed for 2 or fewer persons.
보기4: ④ Riding a motorcycle requires a driver's license.

문제: 402. As the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle is entering an intersection without traffic lights, the driver notices a cyclist entering the same intersection from his/her right. What should he/she do?
보기1: ① The cyclist probably knows a two-wheeled vehicle will be faster than a bicycle, and will yield the right of way to you. Just drive on.
보기2: ② Increase speed so that you reach the intersection first and drive through.
보기3: ③ Stop before entering the intersection and let the bicycle pass first.
보기4: ④ Use the horn to caution the cyclist and drive through.

문제: 403. According to the Promotion of the Use of Bicycles Act, an 'electric bicycle' that is permitted to use bicycle-only lanes is a bicycle mounted with a motor to add power to that of humans, and fulfilling each of the following requirements
404. You are driving a two-wheeled vehicle and see a cyclist pushing his bicycle across the road. Which of the following describes the best method to drive?
보기1: ① There's no reason to protect a cyclist who is crossing the road illegally. Just drive on.
보기2: ② Stop at a safe distance away and let the cyclist cross the road.
보기3: ③ Increase speed and drive around the cyclist.
보기4: ④ Drive through at a reduced speed while keeping an eye on the cyclist.

문제: 405. Which of the following best describes what to do when your two-wheeled vehicle suddenly slides on a snowy or icy road?
보기1: ① Press the brakes
보기2: ② Shift to a higher gear.
보기3: ③ Turn the wheel in the direction in which you are sliding.
보기4: ④ Turn the wheel away from the direction in which you are sliding.

문제: 406. Which of the following is true about child safety-related fines?
보기1: ① The fine for the parent/guardian who negligently allowed a child to play in a busy street is KRW 50,000.
보기2: ② The fine for the parent/guardian who let a child ride a PMD in the street is KRW 100,000.
보기3: ③ The fine for the parent/guardian who let a child ride a bicycle in the street without protective gear is KRW 20,000.

문제: 407. Which of the following correctly describes why nighttime driving is more dangerous for drivers of two-wheeled vehicles than daytime driving?
보기1: ① Driving safety is enhanced thanks to a stabilized sense of speed
보기2: ② Focus and danger-handling capacity are increased
보기3: ③ Speed and accuracy in object detection are increased
보기4: ④ Detection of objects is hindered and visibility reduced

문제: 408. Which of the following statements about the best method to drive and maintain a two-wheeled vehicle is INCORRECT?

보기2: ② Safety helmets must be worn by both the driver and passenger.
보기3: ③ Always check your tires and fuel after getting on the road.

문제: 409. Which of the following statements about why a safety helmet must be worn when driving a two-wheeled vehicle is correct?
보기1: ① A safety helmet helps to reduce drowsiness and fatigue
보기2: ② A safety helmet helps to maintain a safe distance from other vehicles
보기3: ③ A safety helmet helps to maintain a wide field of vision
보기4: ④ A safety helmet protects the head in the event of an accident

문제: 410. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decrees, how many demerit points are given to the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle who exceeded the speed limit by 10km/h in the school zone from 8
411. Which of the following is NOT a characteristic applicable to the driving of a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① The body of the two-wheeled vehicle driver is exposed.
보기2: ② The drivers and two-wheeled vehicles lean in the direction of a turn.

문제: 413. Which of the following is the best explanation of why the tire of a two-wheeled vehicle has a round cross-section?

보기2: ② To help balance the vehicle body easily
보기3: ③ To maintain balance and centrifugal force when negotiating a turn

문제: 414. Which of the following is NOT an advantage two-wheeled vehicles have over four-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① Excellent maneuverability
보기2: ② Wider view

보기4: ④ Higher shock absorption

문제: 415. Which of the following statements regarding the distribution of force for enhanced braking when a two-wheeled vehicle stops suddenly is correct?
보기1: ① The vehicle is designed for the force to be applied more to the front wheel.
보기2: ② The vehicle is designed for the force to be applied more to the rear wheel.
보기3: ③ The vehicle is designed for the force to be applied evenly to both wheels.

보기1: ① Shock
보기2: ② Centrifugal force
보기3: ③ Moment of inertia
보기4: ④ Friction

문제: 417. Which of the following describes the correct reason why the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle should not drive between other motor vehicles by invading the lane marks?
보기1: ① It is because the instant acceleration decreases.
보기2: ② It is because it is hard to secure mobility.
보기3: ③ It is because it is hard to balance the weight of a two-wheeled vehicle.
보기4: ④ It is because it is easy to get inside the blind areas of four-wheeled vehicle drivers.

문제: 418. Which of the following is the most important thing to remember when a two-wheeled vehicle changes direction or takes a turn?
보기1: ① The location of your feet on the foot pegs of the two-wheeled vehicle
보기2: ② Controlling the brake system
보기3: ③ Changing gears
보기4: ④ Leaning position of your body

문제: 419. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following recommendations on selecting a safety helmet for two-wheeled vehicles is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① The helmet should come off easily on impact.
보기2: ② The helmet should absorb shock and be resistant to penetration.
보기3: ③ The helmet should allow sufficient room for left/right and up/down view.
보기4: ④ The helmet should not cause injury to the wearer.

문제: 420. According to the Road Traffic Act and its Enforcement Decree, which of the following is the correct weight standard for a safety helmet to be used with two-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① 1 kg or less
보기2: ② 1.5 kg or less
보기3: ③ 2 kg or less
보기4: ④ 2.5 kg or less

문제: 421. Which of the following recommendations on selecting the visor for a safety helmet to be used with two-wheeled vehicles is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① The visor must be tinted in order to protect the driver’s eyes and vision against the sun.
보기2: ② The visor must not distort the angle of the light.
보기3: ③ The wearer must be able to accurately judge the distance to other objects.
보기4: ④ The visor must be made of safety glass to prevent injuries from shattered glass in the event of an accident.

문제: 422. Which of the following recommendations on selecting a safety helmet for two-wheeled vehicles that securely fits the driver is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① The helmet must be up to the prescribed standards.
보기2: ② The helmet must have good visibility.
보기3: ③ Select a helmet that satisfies your needs and purposes.
보기4: ④ Select a helmet that is slightly bigger than the driver's head.

문제: 423. Which of the following statements about wearing a safety helmet for two-wheeled vehicles is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① A safety helmet protects your head and face in the event of an accident.
보기2: ② Fasten the safety helmet's buckle slightly loosely under the chin.
보기3: ③ A safety helmet absorbs and lessens shock.
보기4: ④ Your safety helmet should not sit too much to the front or to the rear of your head.

문제: 424. Which of the following explanations is NOT correct regarding the safe driving of a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① When entering a curve, you must decelerate according to the size of the curve.
보기2: ② When turning, it is safer to maintain a constant speed rather than decelerating or accelerating.
보기3: ③ It is safe to drive along the 'out-out-out course' on a curved road.
보기4: ④ When turning, it is safest to keep the 'lean with' posture by tilting the driver's body inward rather than operating the steering wheel.

문제: 425. Which of the following statements about a two-wheeled vehicle driver’s field of vision and perspective is correct?
보기1: ① The field of vision is wide to the left and right, and the horizon is set low.
보기2: ② The field of vision is long up and down, and the horizon is set high.
보기3: ③ The field of vision is narrow to the left and right, and the horizon is set high.
보기4: ④ The field of vision is short up and down, and the horizon is set low.

문제: 426. Which of the following guidelines about distributing a two-wheeled vehicle driver’s attention along the field of vision and perspective is correct?
보기1: ① Look close ahead, and do not look wide.
보기2: ② Look far ahead, and look wide.
보기3: ③ Look far ahead, and do not look wide.
보기4: ④ Look close ahead, and look wide.

문제: 427. Which of the following recommendations about the position of a moving two-wheeled vehicle on the road is NOT correct?
보기1: ① Drive along the edge of the lane.
보기2: ② Drive at the center of the lane.
보기3: ③ Do not cut in between vehicles unreasonably.
보기4: ④ Position yourself such that it is easy for other drivers to detect you.

문제: 428. Which of the following statements about the clothing worn by two-wheeled vehicle drivers is NOT correct?
보기1: ① Wear light-colored clothing that protects the body and makes you easily visible.
보기2: ② Wear leather gloves that allow you to move your fingers comfortably.
보기3: ③ It is a good idea to attach reflectors for nighttime driving.
보기4: ④ In the summer, it is better to wear sandals or other breathable shoes; in the winter, wear long leather boots.

문제: 429. According to the Noise and Vibration Control Act, what is the permitted noise standard for two-wheeled vehicles manufactured after Jan. 1, 2006?
보기1: ① 105 db or below
보기2: ② 110 db or below
보기3: ③ 115 db or below
보기4: ④ 120 db or below

문제: 430. Which of the following statements about the moving of two-wheeled vehicles is INCORRECT?
보기1: ① Unlike drivers of four-wheeled vehicles, two-wheeled vehicle drivers tend to look at and around the lane to avoid speed bumps or stray rocks.
보기2: ② Unlike drivers of four-wheeled vehicles, two-wheeled vehicle drivers are directly affected by the wind and find it difficult to control the handle.
보기3: ③ When negotiating a curve, drivers of two-wheeled vehicles use only the handle to change direction.
보기4: ④ When negotiating a curve, two-wheeled vehicle drivers apply the engine brake in advance to slow down.

문제: 431. Which of the following statements about a tandem seat attached to a two-wheeled vehicle is NOT correct?
보기1: ① Due to its increased weight, a tandem seat attached to a two-wheeled motor vehicle accelerates faster and its centrifugal force becomes smaller.
보기2: ② It is very important that the driver and the passenger work together to maintain balance.
보기3: ③ Because it is very important for the driver and the passenger of the tandem seat to work together to slow down, the passenger needs to be sufficiently informed.
보기4: ④ The passenger should not ride when the road is slippery due to snow or rain.

문제: 432. Which of the following is NOT a characteristic the driver of a passenger car must be aware of when encountering a two-wheeled vehicle?
보기1: ① There is no likelihood of a two-wheeled vehicle driving between other vehicles.
보기2: ② Understand that there is a risk that a two-wheeled motor vehicle may be pulled underneath the car when you turn right at an intersection.
보기3: ③ Two-wheeled vehicles are smaller than four-wheeled vehicles, and can easily enter a blind spot in your field of vision.
보기4: ④ Drivers tend to think that two-wheeled vehicles are farther away than they really are due to their small size.

문제: 433. According to the Regulations on the Performance and Safety Standards of Motor Vehicles and Auto Parts, which of the following is not true about the standards for tire markings for two-wheeled vehicles?
보기1: ① Tread wear indicators are spaced through the main grooves in the tire tread that indicate tread depths down to 1.6 mm
보기2: ② Tire manufacturer is marked on at least one side of the tire, either engraved or embossed
보기3: ③ Lot number or a symbol equivalent to lot number is marked on at least one side of the tire, either engraved or embossed
보기4: ④ A symbol indicating the tire name is marked on at least one side of the tire, either engraved or embossed

문제: 434. Which of the following is a cornering technique that drivers of two-wheeled vehicles can use while riding at high speeds on paved roads?
보기1: ① Lean with
보기2: ② Lean out
보기3: ③ Lean brake
보기4: ④ Lean in

문제: 435. Which of the following is a cornering technique that the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle can use on unpaved roads?
보기1: ① Lean with
보기2: ② Lean out
보기3: ③ Lean brake
보기4: ④ Lean in

문제: 436. Which of the following is a basic cornering technique, in which the driver of a two-wheeled vehicle leans inwards at the same angle as the vehicle?
보기1: ① Lean with
보기2: ② Lean out
보기3: ③ Lean brake
